AStr.Run: A stem that is made up of more than one root.
A combination of two lexemes that are phonologically reduced.
A stem that is made up of a root plus an affix that adds a non-inflectional component of meaning.
A multi-word expression that is recognized as a semantic unit.
A combination of a lexical verb and a verbal particle that forms a single semantic and syntactic unit.
Any pithy phrasal expression of wisdom or truth; esp., an adage, proverb, or maxim.
This list holds genre by which interlinear texts can be classified.
A text with a single participant, typically a narrator addressing an audience
An account of events, a text that describes or projects a contingent succession of actions
An account of real events
An account of invented events
A traditional account of events of unknown historicity
An account of events that are projected to happen at a later time, typically involving a supernatural agency
A text that describes or explains a process
Describes how something was done
Gives instructions about how to do something
A text that motivates or describes behavior without a framework of contingent succession
A text intended to motivate the audience to do something or to act or to believe in a particular way; a.k.a. Motivational Text
A text intended to express the norms of a society for the purpose of motivating someone to conform to those norms
A text in which the originator promises to do something or to act or to believe in a particular way
A text, such as a Eulogy, that describes the accomplishments of a person without a contingent succession of actions
A text that explains something other than a behavior, a process or a succession of events; typically it explains facts or ideas
A text dealing with projected facts or planned status (not a proposal for action, which would be Hortatory; not focusing on human or divine agency, which would be Prophecy)
Exposition that describes an object, location or situation in static terms
Exposition specifically intended for teaching another person about a body of facts
Literal speech between individuals or quoted text that uses quotation formulas (typically using the verb 'to say')
Dialogue involving mutual cooperation between the speakers
Dialogue in which the speakers resist mutual resolution of one or more propositions
Dialogue in which a speaker seeks to obtain a benefit from the other speaker
Acted out speech or quoted text that does not use quotation formulas
A list of words used for language research or documentation
A list of well-formed words, typically arranged according to inflection
A list of words that are not well-formed in the language, e.g. an anti-paradigm or list of common misspellings
Genre according to metrical form (versus content)
Non-metrical arrangement of the text, typically using the grammar of ordinary speech
Metrical arrangement of the text, typically employing rules for rhyme and rhythm
A part/whole relation establishes a link between the sense for the whole (e.g., room), and senses for the parts (e.g., ceiling, wall, floor).
A generic/specific relation establishes a link between the sense for the generic (e.g., bird), and senses for the specifics (e.g., robin, cardinal, dove).
Use this type for synonym relationships (e.g., fast, fleet, hasty).
Use this type for antonym relationships (e.g., fast, slow).
Use this type for calendar relationships (e.g., days of week, months in year).
Use this type for relationships that cannot be classified by a specific label, or of which there are too few examples to warrant creating a custom lexical relation.
Use this relation for linking classifiers to the words that they classify.
A particle is a word that does not belong to one of the main classes of words, is invariable in form, and typically has grammatical or pragmatic meaning.
An infix is an affix that is inserted within a root or stem.
A prefix is an affix that is joined before a root or stem.
A simulfix is a change or replacement of vowels or consonants (usually vowels) which changes the meaning of a word. (Note: the parser does not currently handle simulfixes.)
A suffix is an affix that is attached to the end of a root or stem.

A suprafix is a kind of affix in which a suprasegmental is superimposed on one or more syllables of the root or stem, signalling a particular morphosyntactic operation. (Note: the parser does not currently handle suprafixes.)
A circumfix is an affix made up of two separate parts which surround and attach to a root or stem.
A clitic is a morpheme that has syntactic characteristics of a word, but shows evidence of being phonologically bound to another word. Orthographically, it stands alone.
An enclitic is a clitic that is phonologically joined at the end of a preceding word to form a single unit. Orthographically, it may attach to the preceding word.
A proclitic is a clitic that precedes the word to which it is phonologically joined. Orthographically, it may attach to the following word.
A bound root is a root which cannot occur as a separate word apart from any other morpheme.

A root is the portion of a word that (i) is common to a set of derived or inflected forms, if any, when all affixes are removed, (ii) is not further analyzable into meaningful elements, being morphologically simple, and, (iii) carries the principle portion of meaning of the words in which it functions.
A bound stem is a stem which cannot occur as a separate word apart from any other morpheme.

"A stem is the root or roots of a word, together with any derivational affixes, to which inflectional affixes are added." (LinguaLinks Library). A stem "may consist solely of a single root morpheme (i.e. a 'simple' stem as in
man
), or of two root morphemes (e.g. a 'compound' stem, as in
blackbird
), or of a root morpheme plus a derivational affix (i.e. a 'complex' stem, as in
manly
unmanly
manliness
). All have in common the notion that it is to the stem that inflectional affixes are attached." (Crystal, 1997:362)
An infixing interfix is an infix that can occur between two roots or stems.
A prefixing interfix is a prefix that can occur between two roots or stems.
A suffixing interfix is an suffix that can occur between two roots or stems.
A phrase is a syntactic structure that consists of more than one word but lacks the subject-predicate organization of a clause.

A discontiguous phrase has discontiguous constituents which (a) are separated from each other by one or more intervening constituents, and (b) are considered either (i) syntactically contiguous and unitary, or (ii) realizing the same, single meaning. An example is French ne...pas.

This will be one of your richest sources of information. It entails activities and conversations that you witness, but do not control. You may participate actively or passively in the activity you observe. The point is to be curious and approach the activity with questions. Important skills to develop that will make your observations more useful are memory and awareness.

In a conversation, all participants are free to direct and change the course of the activity; a dialogue is egalitarian. Most of your interaction with people is in the form of conversations. Conversations carry few expectations except an assumption of mutual cooperation. Conversations are a good place to start in order to build friendships and establish trust with people.

Interviews involve an intentional request for information on a predetermined topic. The interviewer asks questions and the interviewee(s) provides answers. For this reason an interview is different from a conversation. It is more one-sided. Interviews range from "unstructured" to "structured." The more focus and structure in an interview, the more structured it becomes.

A structured interview is used to obtain comparative data and is therefore intended to be given to more than one person. Consistency is important. The interviewer should ask questions the same way each time and the interviewee should be cued as to the appropriate way to respond (yes/no, multiple choice, short sentence answer, etc.).

Unstructured interviews will likely be the most common type of interview you use. In unstructured interviews, you are usually not concerned with comparing responses and may only give the interview to one person. The goal is to get basic information. The topic is usually approached in a general way, without restricting the how of the respondent answers. Questions are generally open-ended.

A "performance" is a type of observation, but one where the performer(s) expects the performance to be evaluated based on culturally appropriate criteria. One example of a "performance" is a play. Gossip is less obvious but also falls into the performance category.

Literature summaries are not limited to books. You may run across newspaper and magazine articles that have important information. Other sources of information are unpublished manuscripts like MA theses and PhD dissertations, brochures, field notes from other researchers, and letters. Still, don't forget the books. You can make use of this information by appending it directly into the Data Notebook.

Reflection on events and other types of data, such as literature summaries or interviews. An analysis does not add data; it interprets and organizes data. An analysis entry may synthesize emerging themes. It may draw connections between observations. It is a place to speculate and hypothesize, or document moments of discovery and awareness. Analytic notes can be turned into articles. Or, they may just be steps on the stairway toward greater understanding.

An adverb, narrowly defined, is a part of speech whose members modify verbs for such categories as time, manner, place, or direction. An adverb, broadly defined, is a part of speech whose members modify any constituent class of words other than nouns, such as verbs, adjectives, adverbs, phrases, clauses, or sentences. Under this definition, the possible type of modification depends on the class of the constituent being modified.
A noun is a broad classification of parts of speech which include substantives and nominals.

A pro-form is a part of speech whose members usually substitute for other constituents, including phrases, clauses, or sentences, and whose meaning is recoverable from the linguistic or extralinguistic context.
A pronoun is a pro-form which functions like a noun and substitutes for a noun or noun phrase.

A verb is a part of speech whose members typically signal events and actions; constitute, singly or in a phrase, a minimal predicate in a clause; govern the number and types of other constituents which may occur in the clause; and, in inflectional languages, may be inflected for tense, aspect, voice, modality, or agreement with other constituents in person, number, or grammatical gender.

Use this domain for general words referring to the physical universe. Some languages may not have a single word for the universe and may have to use a phrase such as 'rain, soil, and things of the sky' or 'sky, land, and water' or a descriptive phrase such as 'everything you can see' or 'everything that exists'.
把和物质世界有关的词放在这个词群里。在有些语言里可能没有表示“万物”这个意思的词，所以，可能就要用几个有关的词才能把它说明白，比如“天、地和所有的东西”。此外，也可能会需要用句子来 说明，比如“你能看得见的所有东西”或者是“所有存在的东西”。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to everything we can see?
说到我们看得见的所有的东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: universe, creation, cosmos, heaven and earth, macrocosm, everything that exists
宇宙、天地、天地万物、世间万物、宏观世界、宇宙万物、万物、万象

AStr.Run: In the beginning God created <the heavens and the earth>.
起初 神创造<天地>。
Use this domain for words related to the sky.
把和天空有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to refer to the sky?
说到天，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: sky, firmament, canopy, vault
天空、天、空、长空、天宇、苍穹、天穹、天幕、上空、空际、九天、九重霄、九重天、重霄、苍天、上 苍、高空、晴空、青天、碧空、天上、空中、星空、霄、云霄、霄汉、碧落、玉宇

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the air around the earth?
说到地球周围的空气，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: air, atmosphere, airspace, stratosphere, ozone layer
空气、大气、大气层、气团、气层、臭氧层

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used to refer to the place or area beyond the sky?
说到天上面的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: heaven, space, outer space, ether, void, solar system
天堂、天国、天庭、天界、天园、极乐世界、西天、西方、西方净土、外层空间、太空、外太空、宇宙空间、太阳系

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something in the sky or something that happens in the sky?
说到天空里的物体,或在天上发生的事，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: aerial, heavenly, atmospheric, stratospheric, celestial,
空中、仙人、天人、天体、星球、星体、天帝、天兵天将

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe the appearance of the sky?
说到天空的样子，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: blue, clear, black (night), cloudy, cloud filled, brilliant, dark, night sky, foreboding, stormy, dark, star studded
蔚蓝的、蓝色的、广阔的、无边无际的、万里无云的、黑色的（夜晚）、铅黑色的、阴沉沉的、晴朗的、 白云朵朵、多云的、乌云密布、彤云密布、明朗的、灰暗的、夜空、霞光万丈、繁星点点、星光璀璨

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the edge of the sky where it meets the ground?
说到天地相接的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: horizon, skyline
地平线、天边、天际

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to something in the sky?
说到天空中的物体,你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: heavenly body, celestial body, luminary
仙人、天人、天体、星球、星体、天帝、天兵天将、星曜、天府、发光天体

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to the lights that appear in the northern (or southern) sky?
说到北方（或南方）天空中出现的亮光，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: aurora borealis, northern lights
极光、北极光、南极光

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to something being in the sky?
说到物体停留在天空里,你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: aloft, up in the sky, up in the air,
高处、上空、空中、凌空、悬空

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the sun. The sun does three basic things. It moves, it gives light, and it gives heat. These three actions are involved in the meanings of most of the words in this domain. Since the sun moves below the horizon, many words refer to it setting or rising. Since the sun is above the clouds, many words refer to it moving behind the clouds and the clouds blocking its light. The sun's light and heat also produce secondary effects. The sun causes plants to grow, and it causes damage to things.
把和太阳有关的词放在这个词群里。太阳有三种基本的活动 — 转动、发光和发热。这个词群里大多数词的含义就包括有这三种活动。由于太阳会升起，会落下，所以很 多词和日出日落有关。由于有云，所以很多词会表示太阳躲到云后面以及云挡住了太阳光。有了太阳，植 物才可以生长，但太阳发出的光和热也会造成其它的影响，甚至是一些伤害。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the sun?
说到太阳，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: sun, solar, sol, daystar, our star
太阳、日、日头、旭日、朝日、朝阳、夕阳、落日、残阳、斜阳、烈日

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to how the sun moves?
说到太阳是怎么移动的，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: rise, set, cross the sky, come up, go down, sink
跨过（天空）、日出、日升、升、升起、冉冉升起、（太阳）升起来了、日落、（太阳）落下、（太阳）西沉、夕阳西下

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the time when the sun rises?
说到日出的时候，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: dawn, sunrise, sunup, daybreak, cockcrow,
日出、天明、旭日东升、破晓、黎明时分、拂晓

AStr.Run: We got up before <dawn>, in order to get an early start.
为了能得先鞭，我们在<黎明>之前起来。

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the time when the sun is at its highest point?
说到太阳在天空最高处之时，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: noon, zenith,
中午，日中，晌午，正午

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the time when the sun sets?
说到日落的时候，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: sunset, dusk, sundown, twilight, eventide,
日落、（太阳）落下、（太阳）西沉、夕阳西下、日暮、黄昏

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to when the sun is shining?
阳光照耀时，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: shine, sunny, bright, give light, be sunshiny, daytime,
照耀、阳光照耀、阳光普照、阳光灿烂、放光、晴朗的、白天、明亮、透过（云层）、直射、艳阳高照、 烈日当空、照射、投射、投影、映射、映照、闪耀

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to the sun shining through the clouds?
说到通过云彩的阳光，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: come out, break through (the clouds), go behind (a cloud)
(阳光)透过云彩、穿过

Question.AUni: (8) What words describe where the sun is shining?
说到阳光照到的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: sunlit, be (out) in the sun, lit by the sun, shine on, be in the sunlight, sunny (spot)
阳光照亮的、阳光充足的、阳光下的、沐浴在阳光中的、采光充足的、采光好的、采光的、向阳的、当阳 的、太阳地儿、当阳处

Question.AUni: (9) What words describe when or where the sun doesn't shine?
说到没有阳光的时候或是阳光照不到的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: shade, eclipse of the sun, sunless, shady, shadow, eclipse (v),
阴凉处、背阴处、树荫下、背光处、遮荫的、阴凉的、阴影、日食、暗无天日、晚上、夜里、极夜

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to the light of the sun?
哪些词和太阳光有关？

ExampleWords.AUni: sunlight, ray, sunshine, beam, light, sunbeam, radiance, glow, sparkle, glisten, glare
光、阳光、阳光照耀、日光、日光浴、光线、光束、光辉、闪耀、光照、照耀

Question.AUni: (11) What words describe the brightness of the sun?
说到太阳光的明亮度，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: bright, intense, brilliant, blinding, glaring, glistening, luminous, dim
明亮、强烈、炫目、耀眼、夺目、刺眼、晃眼、昏暗

Question.AUni: (12) What refer to the sun heating things?
哪些词说明太阳会使物体发热？

ExampleWords.AUni: warm, heat, dry
暖和、温暖、热、晒、晒干、烤、炙烤、烤干

Question.AUni: (13) What else does the sun do?
太阳还能做些其它什么事？

ExampleWords.AUni: looks down on
使万物生长、杀菌

Question.AUni: (14) What words describe the damage done by sunlight?
阳光会造成哪些伤害？

ExampleWords.AUni: sunburn, sunstroke, suntan, tan, heatstroke, heat prostration, sun damage, fading from the sun, bleached by the sun
晒伤、晒昏、晒黑、晒斑、中暑、虚脱、脱水、晒退色

Question.AUni: (15) What do people use to protect themselves from the sun?
有什么办法可以避免被晒伤？

ExampleWords.AUni: sunglasses, shade tree, suntan lotion, awning, sun umbrella, parasol, sunbonnet, hat, visor
太阳镜、墨镜、太阳伞、阳伞、帽子、草帽、斗笠、太阳帽、遮荫树、凉棚、防晒霜、宽边帽

Question.AUni: (16) What words are used of telling time by the sun?
哪些词指通过太阳来看时间？

ExampleWords.AUni: sundial, angle of the sun, sun-clock, shoot the sun, position of the sun,
日晷、日出三竿、日薄西山、日落西山、太阳偏西、日头偏西

Question.AUni: (17) What words refer to using the power of the sun?
哪些词指使用太阳的能量？

ExampleWords.AUni: solar energy, solar power, solar panel
太阳能、太阳能电池

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the moon. In your culture people may believe things about the moon. For instance in European culture people used to believe that the moon caused people to become crazy. So in English we have words like "moon-struck" and "lunatic." You should include such words in this domain.
把和月亮有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the moon?
指月亮的有哪些词？

ExampleWords.AUni: moon, lunar, satellite
月亮、月、月儿、月牙儿、明月、圆月、月球、月宫、蟾宫、月轮、玉轮、冰轮

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to how the moon moves?
提到月亮怎么移动，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: rise, set, sink

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the time when the moon rises?
提到月亮升起的时候，你会怎么说

ExampleWords.AUni: moonrise, rising of the moon,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the time when the moon sets?
提到月落的时候，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: moonset, setting of the moon,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to when the moon is shining?
提到有月亮的时候，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: moon is shining, by the light of the moon, moon is/comes out,

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe where the moon is shining?
提到月亮光照到的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: moonlit, be in the moonlight, lit by the moon, shine on,

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe when or where the moon doesn't shine?
提到没有月亮的时候，或月光照不到的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: moonless night, eclipse of the moon, eclipse (v),

指月亮的光有哪些词？

ExampleWords.AUni: moonlight, moonbeam, moonshine,
月光、月色、月华、一缕月光、月光如水

Question.AUni: (9) What words describe the brightness of the moon?
提到月亮的光度，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: bright, pale,

Question.AUni: (10) What words describe the appearance of the moon?
提到月亮的样子，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: man in the moon, harvest moon
一轮明月、残月、新月如钩、月牙儿、圆月、月如钩、弯弯的月亮、圆圆的月亮

Question.AUni: (11) What words refer to the spots on the moon?
提到月亮里的黑点，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: lunar sea, crater,

Question.AUni: (12) What words refer to the phases of the moon?
提到月圆月缺这样轮回的有哪些词？

ExampleWords.AUni: phase, new moon, full moon, half moon, quarter moon, crescent, sliver, moon is waxing (getting bigger), moon is waning (getting smaller), wax and wane

Question.AUni: (13) What words refer to the time it takes for the moon to go through its phases?
提到月亮完成一个圆缺轮回所需要的时间，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: (lunar) month
（太阴）月

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the stars and other heavenly bodies.
把和星星及其它天体有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to refer to the stars?
说到星星，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: star, starry, stellar

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used for where the stars are shining?
说到有星光的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: starlit, lit by the stars

Question.AUni: (4) What words are used for when or where the stars don't shine?
说到没有星光的时候或是星光照不到的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: starless (sky, night)

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the light of the stars?
星星发出的光你怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: starlight
星光、星火

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe the brightness of the stars?
说到星光的亮度，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: bright, brilliant, dim, luminous

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe the appearance of the stars?
说到星星的样子，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: twinkle, wink, glittering, star shaped
闪烁、闪耀、眨眼、忽明忽暗、一眨一眨的

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to the study of the stars?
哪些词和研究星星的学问有关？

ExampleWords.AUni: astronomy, astronomer, astrology, astrologer, stargazer, magi
天文学、天文学家、占星术、占星家、星相学

Question.AUni: (9) What is a group of stars called?
如果很多星星在一起，要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: constellation, galaxy, nebula
星座、星宿、星团、星系、天河、银河、银河系

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to planets (large objects that circle the sun, looking like bright wandering stars in the sky), comets (objects that circle the sun, looking like a star with a tail), meteors (small objects that come from space and burn up when they hit the earth's atmosphere, causing a streak of light across the sky), and asteroids (small objects that circle the sun), planetary moons (large objects that circle the planets). Some cultures do not study the stars and will have few or no words in this domain. Others cultures that study the stars will have many words. There are only five planets that people can see in the sky--Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn. The others are only known from the scientific study of astronomy.

把和行星（绕太阳转动的巨大物体，它们在天空中看起来像明亮而位置不固定的星星）、彗星（绕太阳转 动的物体，看起来像拖着尾巴的星星）、流星（来自太空体积较小的物体，穿过地球大气层时会燃烧，然 后会造成一股亮光划过天空）、小行星（绕太阳转动体积较小的物体）和天然卫星（饶行星转动的巨大的 物体）有关的词放在这个词群里。在有些文化背景里，人们并不研究星星，所以这个词群里的词可能会很 少或者根本没有。而如果人们研究星星的话，那么那个地方就会有很多这样的词。

提到行星移动，你怎么说？

哪些词与太阳和所有的行星有关？

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the wind. Some words refer to when the wind begins and ends. The wind changes in speed, so some words refer to how fast the wind is moving. Try to rank these on a scale from very slow to very fast. These words may also be distinguished by what the wind does, since a fast wind does more things. These words may also be distinguished by how long the wind blows. Some words refer to the speed of the wind becoming faster or slower. Some words distinguish a steady wind from a wind in which the speed keeps changing. Some words refer to when the speed of the wind becomes faster for a short time. A steady wind moves in a particular direction, so there are words that include the direction of the wind. The direction of the wind may refer to the points of the compass, a neighboring geographical feature or area, or the direction in which the speaker is moving. Some words refer to a wind that moves in a small circle, making a pillar of dust or a funnel-shaped cloud. Some words refer to what the wind does, such as when it moves or damages something. People can feel the wind, so some words refer to how it feels. The wind makes noise, so there are words that refer to the sound of the wind. In some cultures there is a relation between the wind and spirits, so some words may refer to the activity of the spirits in the wind, or that the wind brings disease.

把和风有关的词放在这个词群里。有些词能表示风什么时候开始吹，什么时候停下来。由于风的速度会改 变，所以有些词可以表示出风的速度有多快，对于这些词尽量把它们按照从慢到快的顺序来排列。有些词 提到风特殊的作为，因为大风具有更强的能力，可以做更多的事。在这些词当中，有些可能会表示风刮了 多长时间；有些会表示风力加强或减弱时风的速度；有些可以区别速度不变的风和速度不断在变化的风； 有些则可能会表示出风速在短时间内有所增强的那一段时间。速度不变的风往往向着固定的方向吹，所以 有些词包含了风向。风向指的可能是某个确切的方位，也可能是某种附近的地理特征或地区，甚至是说话 的人所要去的那个方向。有些词指的是漩涡风，这种风会卷起柱状或漏斗状的烟尘。有些词能表示风的作 为，比如当它吹过或毁坏其它东西时候的景象。我们可以感觉到风的存在，所以有些词表示的就是这样的 感觉。风会发出声音，所以也就有一些词表示的是这样的声音。在有些地方，有些文化当中，风和灵是有 关系的，那么也就有些词表示的是灵在风里面的活动，或者是风会带来疾病。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to the wind?
一般提到风，你会用哪些词？

风、刮风、吹风

大风、狂风、暴风、狂风暴雨、暴风骤雨、风暴、疾风、烈风、飓风、强风、罡风、刚风

说到打旋儿的风，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: whirlwind, tornado, twister, dust devil, funnel, waterspout

ExampleWords.AUni: Chinook, sirocco

Question.AUni: (10) What words describe when the wind begins?
开始刮风了要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: pick up, rise, freshen, gather, blow up

东/南/西/北风、东南/东北/西南/西北风、山风、海风、顶风、迎风、逆风、临风、上风、下风、背风、 过堂风

风能做些什么？

ExampleWords.AUni: blow, knock down (things), rip, tear off, bend, puff out, billow out (sail), push (boat), raise (waves), fan flames, push snow into drifts, ventilate a house
吹拂、扑面、吹干（衣服）、吹倒（树木）、刮倒（房屋）、卷走（屋顶）、卷起（比较轻的东西）、拔 起（树木）、撕裂（房屋）、推动（风车）、通风（房间）

ExampleWords.AUni: whisper, sigh, moan, whistle, howl, scream, shriek

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to earthquakes. In some languages earthquakes are thought of as moving somewhere. In Amele (PNG) they say "mim nen" which means 'the earthquake came down (from above)'. In Northern Embera an earthquake is a "house-shaking". They say "a house-shaking went."
把和地震有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to earthquakes?
哪些词和地震有关？

ExampleWords.AUni: earthquake, quake, tremor, temblor, shock, seismic, upheaval
地震、地动、地震波、震源、震中、震级

Question.AUni: (2) What do earthquakes do?
地震会造成什么样的后果？

ExampleWords.AUni: rock (house, ground), shake (house, ground), crack (ground), knock down (things), cause (buildings) to collapse, ground splits, earth shifts
震倒/震垮/震塌/震坏/震裂（房屋）、海啸、山崩地裂

Question.AUni: (3) Where do earthquakes occur?
地震发生在什么地方？

ExampleWords.AUni: earthquake fault, fault line, epicenter, fissure
地震带、地震断层、震中

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a large wave caused by an earthquake?
说到地震造成的大波浪，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: tidal wave, tsunami,
海啸，津浪，大潮

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words for all plants. Use a book of pictures to identify plant names and the scientific name. Languages divide plants into various domains that are not always comparable from language to language. Criterial features may be characteristics (trees and bushes are distinguished by size and number of trunks) and use (grass and weeds are distinguished by their desirability). A common distinction is between trees and non-trees, with trees described as being big, woody, and having a life expectancy of several years, while non-trees are small, non-woody, and have a life expectancy of typically not more than one year (Heine, Bernd and Karsten Legere. 1995. Swahili plants. Rudiger Koppe Verlag: Koln.). Agricultural societies will divide plants into wild and cultivated. However most plants for which there are names have some use. Therefore it does not seem helpful to divide plant names into domains for useful and non-useful plants. Since only parts of plants are eaten, edible parts of plants are listed under the domain 'Food'. Some languages may have more domains than are used in this list, others may have fewer. The classification system used here does not agree entirely with the system used by botanists. For instance botanists do not classify all the tree species together. The palm trees belong to the class Monocotyledoneae and are classified with lilies, bananas, and orchids. Apple and cherry trees belong to the class Dicotyledoneae and are classified in the rose family along with roses and blackberries. The acacia tree also belongs to the class Dicotyledoneae and is classified in the pulse family along with lupines and beans. However most folk taxonomies bring all the trees together. The scientific classification system for plants and animals is taken from: Carruth, Gorton, ed. 1989. The Volume Library, Vols. 1 and 2. The Southwestern Company: Nashville.

把所有和植物有关的词放在这个词群里。用带图片的书来帮助确定植物的名称和它们对应的学名。在不同的语言当中，植物会被划分成不同的类，而且它们之间不会是完全对应的。划分的标准可能是植物的特征（树和灌木是以大小及主干的数量来区分的）和用途（草和杂草是以人对它是否需要来区分的）。一种常见的划分标准就是树木与非树木。树木指的是高大、木质性且生命周期较长的植物，而非树木则是指矮小、非木质性且生命周期通常不超过一年的植物。以农业为主的地区往往把植物分成野生和种植性两类。由于大多数能够叫得出名字的植物都有一定的用途，所以把它们按有用和无用来分不太合适。对于植物，我们往往只会吃其中的某些部分，这些可以吃的部分就被归到“食物”这一词群下。有关植物的词群在有些语言中可能会比这个列表中的要多，而在另一些语言中则可能会少一些。这里所用到的分类方法和植物学家所使用的方法并不完全相同。例如，植物学家不会把所有的树种放在一起来分类。棕树属于单子叶植物纲，和百合、香蕉、兰花同属一类。苹果和樱桃树都属于双子叶植物纲，和玫瑰、黑莓一样同属玫瑰科。金合欢树也属于双子叶植物纲，和羽扇豆及豆荚同属于豆科。然而，大多数民间的分类法都是将所有的树种放到一起来分的。

AStr.Run: Use this domain for trees--flowering plants with roots, stems, and leaves, which are large and have a wooden trunk (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Angiospermae). Also include the evergreen trees (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Gymnospermae). Evergreen trees do not have flowers, but have cone like fruits (pinecones) that contain seeds. Their leaves are shaped like needles and are retained for over a year.
把和树（有根、茎、叶，高大并有木质树干会开花的植物）有关的词放在这个词群里。此外也要包括常绿性树木。常绿性树木不开花，但会结出含有种子的锥形果实（松球），并有像针一样的树叶，而且一年以上不会落叶。

AStr.Run: Use this domain for small plants that have roots, stems, flowers, and seeds, but do not have a wooden trunk (Phylum Spermatophyta, Subdivision Angiospermae). Also include the seedless plants, such as ferns (phylum Pteridophyta, class Felicineae), horsetails (phylum Pteridophyta, class Equisetineae), and club mosses (phylum Pteridophyta, class Lycopodineae). Plants of the Pteridophyta phylum have no flowers or seeds. Ferns have large, divided, feather-like leaves, or fronds. Club mosses are small (rarely over one meter) evergreen plants with simple leaves resembling pine or hemlock needles. Sometimes they grow upright, but often trail on the ground, where they propagate by means of runners. Horsetails send up tall, vertical, jointed stalks with branches covered with scale like leaves.

有些植物比较矮小，有根、茎、花、种子，但却没有枝干（种子植物门被子植物亚门），把和这类植物有关的词放在这个词群里。此外也要包括没有种子的植物，如蕨类植物（羊齿门Felincineae纲）、木贼属植物（羊齿门Equisetineae纲）和石松属植物（羊齿门石松纲）。羊齿类植物不会开花也没有种子。蕨类植物则有大而分开的像羽毛一样的叶子。石松属植物是矮小（很少超过一米）的常绿植物，它们叶子形状简单，像松针，虽然有时也会向上生长，但通常都是通过长匐茎依附在地面生长。木贼属植物垂直向上长得很高，枝干上有结，分支上覆盖着鱼鳞状的树叶。

AStr.Run: Use this domain for mosses (phylum Bryophyta, class Musci), liverworts (phylum Bryophyta, class Hepaticae), fungi (phylum Thallophyta, subdivision Fungi), algae (phylum Thallophyta, subdivision Algae), and lichens. These plants do not have true roots, stems, or leaves. The mosses are small, green, flowerless plants that grow in moist environments and look like velvety or feathery growths carpeting the ground, tree trunks, and rocks. The liverworts are similar to the mosses with a flat and branching growth pattern. The algae possess green chlorophyll. They vary from one-celled organisms, which sometimes live in colonies such as pond scum, to complex organisms such as seaweed. The fungi do not possess chlorophyll and feed off of other organic material. Lichens consist of a fungus and an algae growing together. They commonly grow on trunks of trees and rocks. Some are flat and leafy, and some are moss like.

把和苔藓（苔藓门苔藓纲）、欧龙牙草（苔藓门苕纲）、真菌（藻菌门真菌亚门）、藻类（藻菌门藻类亚 门）以及地衣有关的词放在这个词群里。这些植物都没有真正的根、茎、叶。苔藓生长在潮湿的环境里， 不会开花，看起来就像覆盖在地面、树干以及岩石上的绿色地毯。地钱和苔藓很相似，不过却长着扁平的 分枝。藻类含有叶绿素，它们介于淡水绿藻中所寄居的有机体和海藻一类的复杂有机体之间。真菌不含叶 绿素，是靠其它的有机物为生。地衣由共同生长在一起的一个真菌和一个藻组成，通常生长在岩石和树干 上，有的扁平有的有叶子，有的则像苔藓。

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that refer to parts of a plant. Start with general words that all plants have. Then think through each major type of plant. Finish by thinking of specific plants that are well known (usually cultivated crops) and that have words for specific parts (e.g. tassel on a corn/maize cob).
把和植物各部分有关的词放在这个词群里。先从所有植物都有的部分开始，然后是每一种常规的植物，最后是人们熟知特殊的植物（通常是人工种植的农作物）和有词语描述其特殊部分的植物（如：玉米穗、玉米棒子）。

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing types of animals. Use a book of pictures to identify each species and its scientific name. This section is organized according to the scientific, biological classification of animals. It may not correspond to the local classification of animals (folk taxonomy), which are often based on how people relate to animals (tame/wild, edible/work). Use this domain for words referring to large classes of animals that do not correspond to the scientific classification. For instance this would be the place for a word like 'flying animal', which includes birds, bats, and flying insects.

把描述动物种类的词放在这个词群里。用带有图片的书帮助确定每一个种类以及它的学名。由于这里使用的是科学和生物学的分类法，所以和你们当地的动物分类法可能会有所不同。民间的分类方法往往是基于人和动物之间的关系（如驯服还是具有野性；用于食用还是用于工作）。有的分类法会把动物分作一些大类，尽管这种方法并不符合科学分类法，但请把和这些大类有关的词也放在这个词群里。例如“飞行动物”这个词就包括了鸟、蝙蝠和飞行昆虫。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to types of animals?

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to animals growing fur, feathers, or new skin?
提到动物长毛、羽毛、或皮，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: molt, shed, down, fledge,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to eggs.
把和蛋有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to an egg?
提到蛋你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: egg
蛋

Question.AUni: (2) What types of eggs are there?
有什么样的蛋？

ExampleWords.AUni: bird egg, reptile egg, insect egg
鸟蛋、爬行动物的蛋、昆虫蛋

Question.AUni: (3) What are the parts of an egg?
蛋包含哪些部分？

ExampleWords.AUni: shell, eggshell, yoke, white, membrane, embryo
蛋壳、蛋黄、蛋白、蛋青、蛋膜、气室

Question.AUni: (4) What is a baby bird called?
提到幼鸟，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: chick, baby bird, hatchling
幼鸟、雏鸟

Question.AUni: (5) What do birds do to eggs?
鸟对于蛋会做些什么？

ExampleWords.AUni: lay, sit on, incubate, roust, turn, fertilize
下蛋、生蛋、孵蛋、抱蛋、翻（动）蛋

Question.AUni: (6) Where do birds lay their eggs?
鸟会把蛋下在哪里？

ExampleWords.AUni: nest
（鸟）巢、（鸟）窝

Question.AUni: (7) What is a group of eggs called?
一窝蛋要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: clutch
一窝蛋

Question.AUni: (8) How do baby birds get out of their egg?
雏鸟怎么从蛋里出来？

ExampleWords.AUni: hatch, peck its way out of the egg
孵化、破壳、破壳而出、钻出来

Question.AUni: (9) What words are used for opening an egg?
怎么样可以把蛋弄开？

ExampleWords.AUni: crack, break, smash
打碎、剥开、敲碎、磕碎

Question.AUni: (10) What words are used to describe a bad egg?
蛋坏了要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: rotten, cracked, broken
臭了、臭蛋、碎了、打碎了、破开了

AStr.Run: Use this domain for actions of animals.
把和动物的动作有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the ability of an animal to do something without learning it?
提到动物天生就具有的能力，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: instinct, instinctive
本能、本能的、与生俱来的、天生的

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to animals hunting?
提到动物的捕猎行为，要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: hunt, stalk, prey
捕猎、猎捕、捕杀、猎杀、狩猎、捕食、追踪捕食

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to animals sleeping during the winter?
动物在冬天睡觉要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: hibernate
冬眠、蛰伏

Question.AUni: (4) What do birds do?
鸟会做什么事情？

ExampleWords.AUni: roost, (hen) gathers chicks
栖息、筑巢、梳理羽毛、迁徙、产卵、歌唱、哀鸣、鸣/啼叫、飞翔、翱翔、掠过（水面）

Question.AUni: (5) What do snakes do?
蛇会做什么事情？

ExampleWords.AUni: strike, coil, crush (prey), sun (themselves), venom,
攻击、缠绕、晒太阳、偷蛋、立起来（眼镜蛇）、喷射毒液、咬（人）

Question.AUni: (6) What do fish do?
鱼会做什么事情？

ExampleWords.AUni: spawn, lay eggs
产卵、摆子、回游、聚集成群、抢水（逆流向上俗语）、逆流而上、顺流而下

Question.AUni: (7) What do insects do?
昆虫会做什么事情？

ExampleWords.AUni: sting, collect nectar
叮咬、采蜜、飞舞、铺天盖地

AStr.Run: Use this domain for ways in which animals move. Only include words specific for the movement of animals. For the movement of people use the domains under Movement. It is necessary to think through how each type of animal moves, especially the important ones.
把动物动作有关的词放在这个词群里。只要和动物动作有关的词。表示人动作的词会单独放在“动作”这个词群里。通过每一种动物做动作的方式来思考会比较好，尤其是那些重要的动物。

Question.AUni: (1) How do mammals move?
哺乳动物有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: gallop, trot, hop, crawl, fly, soar
走、跑、奔跑、疾驰、飞奔、飞跑、小跑、疾走、跳跃、爬行、蠕动、飞行、飞翔

Question.AUni: (2) How do cows move?
牛有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: walk, trot, wander, lie down, charge
走动、慢走、漫步、小跑、躺下、卧倒

Question.AUni: (3) How do dogs move?
狗有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: trot, run, wag its tail
走、小跑、跑、奔跑、狂奔、跳、趴下、坐下、打滚、摇尾巴、用后脚站立、匍匐前进

Question.AUni: (4) How do horses move?
马有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: run, gallop, trot, canter, buck, kick, race, charge
走、小跑、慢跑、奔跑、疾驰、跳跃、跃起、踢、尥蹶子

Question.AUni: (5) How do lions move?
狮子有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: walk, stalk, charge, run down, prowl
走、潜行、趴下、猛冲、奔跑

Question.AUni: (6) How do whales move?
鲸鱼有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: breach
跃出水面、转动身体、（用尾巴）拍打水面

Question.AUni: (7) How do birds move?
鸟有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: fly, flutter, soar, dive, swoop, bank, turn, (hummingbird) hover, hop, roost, hang in the air, ride the wind, alight, land
飞翔、翱翔、展翅、振翅（高飞）、拍打翅膀、俯冲、潜入水中、盘旋、悬停（蜂鸟）、蹦跳、走动、 起飞、着陆

Question.AUni: (8) How do snakes move?
蛇有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: slither, glide
滑动、爬行、缠绕、蛇行、攀爬、游动

Question.AUni: (9) How do fish move?
鱼有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: swim, leap
游动、跃出水面、倒退

Question.AUni: (10) How do insects move?
昆虫有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: fly, hover, dive-bomb, crawl
飞舞、盘旋、俯冲、爬行、跳跃、蹦跳

Question.AUni: (11) How do worms move?
蠕虫有哪些动作？

ExampleWords.AUni: crawl, inch along, creep
爬行、蠕动、钻进/出

Question.AUni: (12) What words refer to the annual migration of animals?
动物每年的迁移要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: migrate, migration, fly south
迁移、迁徙、南飞、飞回北方

Question.AUni: (13) What words refer to animals moving in a group?
说到大群动物一起移动，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: herd (v), flock (v), swarm (v), herd instinct, fly in formation, move as a herd,

Question.AUni: (14) What words refer to animal tracks?
说到动物留下的足迹，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: track,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to animals eating. Because animals often eat in very different ways from people, many languages will have words that are specific to the way an animal eats.
把和动物吃东西有关的词放在这个词群里。由于动物吃东西的方法和不大一样，所以很多语言在这方面都有特殊的词汇

Question.AUni: (1) How do mammals eat?
动物怎么样吃东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: graze, feed, chew the cud
啃食、啄食、滤食、舔食、反刍

Question.AUni: (2) How do carnivores eat?
食肉动物怎么样吃东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: devour, gorge, tear (prey)
撕咬、撕扯、大嚼、吞食、狼吞虎咽

Question.AUni: (3) How do birds eat?
鸟怎么样吃东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: peck,
啄食

Question.AUni: (4) How do snakes eat?
蛇怎么样吃东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: swallow
吞

Question.AUni: (5) How do insects eat?
(5)昆虫怎么样吃东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: suck blood, bloodsucking, chew (holes in leaves)
吸食（血）、啃咬

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the sounds animals make. It is necessary to think through the sounds each type of animal makes, especially the important ones.
把有关动物发出的声音的词放在这个词群里。可以通过每一种动物所发出的声音来思考，尤其是那些重要的动物。

通常提到动物发出的声音，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: cry, call, scream,
叫声

Question.AUni: (2) What sounds do cows make?
牛会发出什么样的声音？

马会发出什么样的声音？

羊会发出什么样的声音？

ExampleWords.AUni: baa, bleat
咩、

猪会发出什么样的声音？

ExampleWords.AUni: grunt, snort, squeal,

狗会发出什么样的声音？

ExampleWords.AUni: bark, bay, howl, yap, growl, snap, snarl, whimper, whine, woof woof, yelp, yowl,

猫会发出什么样的声音？

狮子会发出什么样的声音？

鼠会发出什么样的声音？

鸣叫、歌唱、叽叽喳喳、啁啾声、啭鸣、哀鸣、悲鸣、尖叫、啸叫、枭叫、啼鸣、呱呱/哑哑（乌鸦）、 呷呷/嘎嘎（鸭、鹅）、咕咕（鸽子）、啾啾

鸡会发出什么样的声音？

蛇会发出什么样的声音？

ExampleWords.AUni: croak, rivet

鳄鱼会发出什么样的声音？

鱼会发出什么样的声音？

ExampleWords.AUni: buzz, chirp, chirr, drone, whine, gnaw

AStr.Run: Use this domain for animal homes. It is necessary to think through the homes of each type of animal, especially the important ones.
把和动物的家有关的词放在这个词群里。需要从每一种动物的家来考虑，尤其是那些重要的动物。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to where an animal lives?
一般提到动物住的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: habitat, the wild
栖息地、聚居地、栖所、居住地

Question.AUni: (2) Where do mammals live?
哺乳动物住在哪里？

ExampleWords.AUni: den, hole, burrow, molehill

Question.AUni: (3) What other places do mammals use?
哺乳动物还会使用其它哪些地方？

ExampleWords.AUni: wallow, hunting grounds, watering hole, pasture, range, trail
泥坑、泥塘、水塘、水坑、牧场、领地

Question.AUni: (4) Where do birds live?
鸟住在哪里？

ExampleWords.AUni: nest, birds nest, perch, range
巢、鸟巢、鸟洞、树洞、墙洞、领地

Question.AUni: (5) Where do snakes live?
蛇住在哪里？

ExampleWords.AUni: snake pit, den of vipers, snake hole

ExampleWords.AUni: spawning grounds

Question.AUni: (7) Where do insects live?
昆虫住在哪里？

ExampleWords.AUni: anthill, ants nest, termite mound, termite hill, hive, beehive, bee's wax, honeycomb, spider web, cocoon, trail (of ants)

蜘蛛住在哪里？

ExampleWords.AUni: spider web, cobweb

蠕虫住在哪里？

ExampleWords.AUni: wormhole
虫眼、虫孔、蛀孔、土壤、腐肉、寄主体内

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to groups of animals.
把和动物群体有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a group of mammals?
一群哺乳动物要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: herd (of cattle), drove (of cattle), kennel (of dogs), pack (of dogs), pride (of lions), pod (of whales)
一群（牛、羊、鹿）、一窝（小狗、小猪、小老鼠）

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a group of birds?
一群鸟要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: flock (of birds), bevy, colony, covey, flight, flock, gaggle
一群、一队（有秩序排列的，如大雁）

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a group of fish?
一群鱼要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: school (of fish), shoal
一群

Question.AUni: (4) What is a group of insects called?
一群昆虫要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: swarm (of insects), plague of locusts
一群、一窝

Question.AUni: (5) What is a group of small animals called?
一群小型动物要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: culture
一窝

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the leader of a group of animals?
一群动物中领头的要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: alpha male
头（羊、鹿）、带领者、领头的

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to the followers in a group of animals?
一群动物中那些普通的跟随者要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: harem
跟随者、追随者

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to a group of baby animals?
一群幼小的动物要怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: brood, clutch (of eggs), kit, litter (of kittens), farrow (of pigs)
一窝

Question.AUni: (9) What other words relate to groups of animals?
提到一群动物还有哪些其它的说法？

ExampleWords.AUni: herd instinct

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to male and female animals. Most languages have special words for the male and female of a species only for domesticated animals. Sometimes there will be a word for the male and not the female, and vice versa (male dog, bitch). Sometimes the word for one is also used generically (cow for both female and generic).
把有关动物雌雄的词放在这个词群里。在大多数语言里，驯化后的某一种动物会有专门的词汇来表示它们的雌雄。有时，有表示雄性的却没有表示雌性的，有时情况又会刚好反过来。有时一个词即可以泛指这种动物，也可以特指雌性或雄性。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a male or female animal?
提到雌性或雄性动物，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: male, female, bitch, tom, tomcat, bull, bullock, cow, heifer, ram, ewe, billy goat, nanny goat, boar, sow, stallion, mare, filly, stag, buck, hart, doe, vixen, lioness, tigress, bull elephant, rooster, cock, hen, drake, peacock, peahen
公/母（牛、羊、马、猪、狗、兔、鸡）、雄/雌（狮、鹿、鸭、鸟）、牡/牝（马、鸡）

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to nature and the environment--the world around us. Include words that refer to how people damage or protect nature.
自然环境就是指我们周围的世界，把有关自然环境的词放在这个词群里，也要包括人类如何保护和破坏环境的词。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the world around us?
提到我们周围的世界，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: world, nature, environment, environmental
世界、自然、环境、自然环境、自然界

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to damaging the environment?
提到环境的破坏，你会想到什么？

ExampleWords.AUni: pollute, pollution, pollutant, acid rain, smog, deforestation, global warming, greenhouse effect
污染、污染源、污染物、白色污染、酸雨、沙漠化、石漠化、砍伐森林、水土流失、温室效应、全球变暖、厄尔尼诺现象、烟尘、沙尘暴、一次性（筷子）、不可降解的（塑料袋）、工业废水、工业/生活垃圾、农药、化肥、臭氧空洞、氟里昂、汽车尾气

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to protecting the environment?
提到保护环境，你会想到什么？

ExampleWords.AUni: conserve, conservation, recycle, biodegradable
回收利用、保持水土、植树造林、封山育林、生物灭虫、农家肥、圈肥、绿色和平组织

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the study of the environment?
什么学问是研究自然环境的？

ExampleWords.AUni: ecology
生态学

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to a person who studies or tries to protect the environment?
研究或努力要保护环境的是什么人？

ExampleWords.AUni: environmentalist, conservationist, ecologist, Green Party
生态学者/家、环保主义者、环境保护论者、自然资源保护论者、绿色和平组织成员

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something that is natural--something in the world around us, as opposed to something that has been made or changed by people.
把有关天然的词放在这个词群里。自然产生在我们周围的，不是人造或被人改造的。

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is natural?

ExampleWords.AUni: natural, naturally, wild (animals, country), raw (materials), virgin (forest), untamed, organic

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words for a person or all mankind.
把和人或人类有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a single member of the human race?
提到人类单一的一个成员，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: person, human being, man, individual, figure
人

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a person when you aren't sure who the person is?
当你提到一个不确定的人的时候，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: someone, somebody
某人、某某人、有人、有个人

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to more than one person?
提到一个以上的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: people, folks, population, the public, populace,
人们、人民、众人、大众、大家、大伙、一伙人

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the entire human race?
提到世界上所有的人，你会怎么说

ExampleWords.AUni: man, men, mankind, the human race, humanity, humankind,

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe something characteristic of all people?
提到人类的特性，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: human (adj), human nature

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe something characteristic of one person?
提到一个人的特性，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: personal, personally,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to no person?
表示没有人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: no one, nobody

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words for the whole human body, and general words for any part of the body. Use a drawing or photo to label each part. Some words may be more general than others are and include some of the other words. For instance 'head' is more general than 'face' or 'nose'. Be sure that both general and specific parts are labeled.
把有关人整个身体和身体各部位的普通词汇放在这个词群里。用图片或照片标出每个部位。有些词可能比其它的词更具综合性，并涵盖了其它一些词的意思。例如，“头”就包括了“脸”和“鼻子”。综合性部位和特定部位都需要标出来。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the body?
提到整个身体，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: body,
身体、身子、身躯

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the shape of a person's body?
提到身体的型状，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: build, figure, physique,
体型、体形、体魄、身材、身态、身影、体态、体格、体质、体魄

Question.AUni: (3) What general words refer to a part of the body?
通常提到身体的一个组成部分，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: part of the body, body part, anatomy, appendage, member, orifice,
零件（玩笑语）、部分、部件、部位

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something about your body?
提到身体的状态，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: physical, physically, bodily,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to cells?
提到细胞，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: cell, cellular, chromosome, protoplasm,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the female reproductive organs and a woman's monthly menstrual cycle. Some of these terms may be taboo. Care must be exercised in which terms are included in the dictionary. A group of women should decide which terms are 'public' and can go in the dictionary, and which would be considered taboo, overly crude, or embarrassing. For example some societies have been afraid that their women will be taken advantage of if these terms are known.
把关于女性生殖器官和月经周期的词放在这个词群里。有些这样的词人们可能比较忌讳。务必要慎重选择适 合收入字典的词。需要由一些女性自己来决定哪些词比较容易接受，可以收录在字典里，而哪些词是比较粗 俗、令人尴尬、应当禁忌的。比如在有些地方一直都会担心一旦这方面的词被人知道了，就会对他们那里的 妇女不利。

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to traditional medicine. There may be no distinction in terminology between 'modern medicine' and 'traditional medicine.' In that case this domain should be ignored. (Our purpose here is not to judge the value of traditional medicine, but to collect and describe the words used for it.)
把和传统医学有关的词放在这个词群里。有些语言在用词上对于“当代医学”和“传统医学”可能并没有差别，如果是这样的话就可以跳过这一词群。（我们这里的目的不是要讨论传统医学的价值，而只是希望收集相关的词汇。）

AStr.Run: Use this domain for all the words related to arranging a marriage. Cultures vary widely in their practices. In some cultures marriages are arranged by the parents. In other cultures a man must seek a wife for himself. Some cultures allow either practice or a combination of the two. So some of the questions below may be inappropriate to your culture.
把所有和安排婚姻有关的词放在这个词群里。不同的文化在这方面会有很大的差异。有些地方婚姻是由 父母来安排的，有些地方男的必须自己来选择自己的妻子，而有的地方两种情况都是允许的。所以下面 有些问题可能并不适合您当地的情况。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the process of arranging a marriage?

ExampleWords.AUni: arrange a marriage, arranged marriage, marriage negotiations, match, espousals, marry off,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to asking someone to marry you?

ExampleWords.AUni: ask someone to marry you, propose, pop the question, proposal,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to formally agreeing to get married?

ExampleWords.AUni: get engaged, engagement, set a date,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to an announcement of a proposed marriage?

ExampleWords.AUni: wedding announcement, announce your engagement, banns,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the state of being engaged to be married?
提到订婚，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: engaged, engagement, betrothed, betrothal, espoused, promised,
订/定婚、订/定亲、许配、许婚、婚约、许配人家、有人家儿

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the people who are engaged to be married?
提到定了婚的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: fiancé, fiancée, engaged couple, bride-to-be, husband-to-be,
未婚妻、未婚夫、未婚夫妇

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to a person who helps with the negotiations?
提到在男女中间帮助撮合的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: matchmaker, go-between
媒人、红娘、月下老人、月老、媒婆、中间人、介绍人

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to a gift or payment given to your future spouse or their family?

ExampleWords.AUni: engagement ring, bride price, dowry

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to a man trying to get a woman to marry him?

ExampleWords.AUni: court, courtship, woo, suit, suitor, date, flirt,

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to the age at which a person can get married?

ExampleWords.AUni: marriageable age, coming out party, eligible, nubile,

Question.AUni: (11) What words refer to marrying secretly?

ExampleWords.AUni: elope,

提到注意到什么东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: notice, spot, become aware, detect, note, perceive, observe, conscious of, catch someone's eye, take note,
发现、发觉、看见、看到、看出来、认出、意识到、察觉、觉察、注意到、感觉到、观察到、观测到、 引起注意、引人注目、惹眼、抢眼

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe someone who is good at noticing things?
提到人善于发现周围的事物，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: observant, perceptive, eagle-eyed, have eyes like a hawk, have eyes in the back of your head, powers of observation
洞悉、洞晓、洞察、洞穿、看透、看穿、看破、识破、观察敏锐、观察细致、观察仔细、目光敏锐、 目光犀利、观察能力强、有洞察力、敏感、细心、仔细、心细、留心

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to not noticing something?
提到没有注意到什么东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: not notice, miss, overlook, fail to notice, escape someone's notice, unnoticed, go unnoticed
没注意、没看见、忽视、忽略、疏忽、错过、遗漏、遗、漏、疏漏、不惹眼、不引人注目、不抢眼

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe someone who is not good at noticing things?
提到人不善于发现周围的事物，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: unobservant, unperceptive, oblivious, can't see the forest for the trees, got your head in the clouds
粗心、大意、马虎、粗枝大叶、马大哈、迟钝、不善于观察、不敏感

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to trying to get someone to notice something?

ExampleWords.AUni: call attention to, bring something to someone's attention, point out

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to trying to get someone to not notice something?

ExampleWords.AUni: distract,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a mental state when the mind is working hard.

ExampleWords.AUni: pay attention, keep your mind on, take note, attentive, devote attention to,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to paying a lot of attention to something?

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to paying attention to something?

ExampleWords.AUni: pay attention to, devote attention to, turn your attention to, focus on, concentrate on, give something/someone your undivided attention, attend to,

ExampleWords.AUni: be engrossed in, be wrapped up in, be absorbed in, be immersed in, immerse yourself in, preoccupied,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to stop paying attention?

ExampleWords.AUni: turn off, switch off,

ExampleWords.AUni: not pay attention, daydream, be miles away, your mind wanders, inattentive, pay very little attention, mind is elsewhere, ignore, take no notice, goes in one ear and out the other,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to making someone pay attention to you?

ExampleWords.AUni: get attention, attract attention, draw attention to yourself,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to making someone pay attention to something?

ExampleWords.AUni: draw attention to, call attention to, bring something to someone's attention, point out, focus attention on, highlight,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to receiving a lot of attention from people?

ExampleWords.AUni: get attention, attract attention, attention, be the center of attention, be the focus of attention,

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to trying to stop someone from paying attention to something?

ExampleWords.AUni: distract someone's attention, divert attention, distracted, distraction, diversion,

Question.AUni: (11) What words refer to trying to prevent people from paying attention to you?

ExampleWords.AUni: not want to draw attention to yourself, keep a low profile, low key,

Question.AUni: (12) What words refer to paying attention to more than one thing?

ExampleWords.AUni: attention is divided,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to ignoring someone--to not look at, listen to, or talk to someone because you think they are not important or you don't like them.

提到忽视某人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: ignore, not pay any attention to, pay no attention to, not take any notice of, take no notice of, don't mind me/her/them, shrug off, not want to know, take someone for granted, avoid, refuse to acknowledge, don't greet

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to ignoring something bad that is happening?

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to ignoring someone by rudely pretending not to see them?

ExampleWords.AUni: trample on, trample underfoot, ride roughshod over,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to casting lots--to make a decision by chance.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to feeling excited--to feel good when something good has happening or is about to happen.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to attracting someone's attention to something. In a typical situation, a person sees something with an interesting quality. The person moves closer, pays close attention to the thing, and possibly does something to it.

ExampleWords.AUni: appeal (n), the lure of, charm, pull (n), draw (n)

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to feeling indifferent about something.

ExampleWords.AUni: not my problem, not my concern, that's your problem, (that's just) tough

Question.AUni: (8) What expressions do people use when they don't care?
人们不在乎的时候会说些什么？

AStr.Run: What the hell! So what? Who cares? I don't care. I could care less. See if I care. I don't give a care. I don't give a damn. I'm indifferent. What difference does it make? What's the difference? It makes no difference to me. It's all the same to me. Never mind! It doesn't matter (to me). Close enough.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that express the idea that something (said, written, thought, or made) depicts or is about a subject, or that something is logically related to some topic. Also use this domain for words that mark the topic or subject of what is being thought about, talked about, or written about. Verbs of thinking, knowing, or speaking (including other types of expression) can take a 'topic' role. We can think of a 'topic' as the main idea. Use this domain also for the important thing in a picture.
表示思考、认识或说话的动词能够扮演一个‘话题’的角色。把指明一个话题或正在思考、谈论或写作的主题的词放在这个词群里。我们思考时脑中的主要概念就是一个‘话题’。把有关一幅图中主要事物的词也放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to being about something or someone?

ExampleWords.AUni: be about something, concern, deal with, be concerned with, center on, focus on, address, cover, depict, discuss, dwell on, present, portray, treat,

AStr.Run: The book <is about> the President.; The meeting <is about> the schedule.; The story <depicts> the life of the President.; The story <presents> a view of the President.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate what something is about?

ExampleWords.AUni: about, on, concerning, on the subject of, regarding, re, with regard to, in, of,

AStr.Run: John was talking <about> the new seed he bought.; I read <about> John in the newspaper.; a book <about> the President; the book <on> the President; the picture <of> the President; an experiment <concerning> growing rice; a course <in> history

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the thing something is about?

ExampleWords.AUni: subject, topic, theme, issue, question, matter, business, thing,

AStr.Run: The <subject> of the book is the President.; The <topic> of the discussion is efficiency.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for obscene words related to sex, defecation, death, damnation, and other taboo or offensive subjects. It is important to check the appropriateness of including obscene words in the dictionary. It should be the choice of the speakers of the language whether a word should be included or excluded. Obscene words included in the dictionary should be clearly marked as such. Obscenity is often used to heighten the emotion of an expression, and is often used when someone is angry. Obscenity is often associated with sex or defecation. Cursing is often associated with God, religion, or the afterlife. Insults often involve equating a person with an animal that is associated with an undesirable characteristic, questioning someone's parentage/legitimacy, questioning someone's character, or questioning someone's intelligence/sanity.
把有关性、排泄、死亡、咒诅的冒犯性或禁忌性词汇放在这个词群里。把具有冒犯性的词语收入词典之前很重要的一点就是需要确认它是否合适被收入，所以应当由说那种语言的人来确定那个词是应当收入还是应当排除在外。被收入词典当中的具有冒犯性的词还应当作出特别的标注，因为它们往往表达的是一种很强烈的感情。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to speech that is considered offensive or improper?

ExampleWords.AUni: bad language, strong language, swear word, four letter word, curse, obscenities, profanity, swearing, unprintable,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to using obscenity?

ExampleWords.AUni: swear, curse, cuss,

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used in an obscene way?
说脏话的时候，人们会用哪些词？

ExampleWords.AUni: damn, damn it, God damn, Hell, shit, screw, fuck, bastard, son of a bitch, bitch,
他妈的、他奶奶的、他姥姥的、该死的、挨刀的、挨千刀的、我操、我靠、狗屁、放屁、老子、老不死

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe speech or actions that are obscene?

ExampleWords.AUni: obscene, coarse, crude, dirty, filthy, improper, indecent, lewd, naughty, profane, risqué, rude, saucy, suggestive, vulgar,

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe someone who uses obscenities a lot?

ExampleWords.AUni: foul-mouthed,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to showing or indicating something--if something (such as an object, something said, or something that happens) shows something, it makes people think of something or understand something (e.g. When his face turns red, it indicates he is angry.)

表明、显示、显明、证明、证实、反映、说明

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to relationships between people and groups of people.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to helping someone.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to fighting someone. A fight can use words, various kinds of weapons, or other actions. For fights that only use words use the domain 'Quarrel'.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to God--the supreme being in the universe. Each theological system will have different beliefs concerning the existence and nature of God. Our purpose here is to collect and define the terms used to refer to the supreme deity. If there is no such person in the theological system, then use this domain for other terms for the pantheon of gods, ultimate reality, nirvana, and similar concepts. However most theological systems, even atheism, have the concept of a supreme God and use words to refer to him.
把和神（宇宙当中的至高者）有关的词放在这个词群里。每一种神学体系对于神的存在和属性都会有不同的认定。我们在这里只希望收集和定义那些有关至高神的词汇。如果在你们的神学体系里没有这样一位至高者，那么就把有关诸神、主宰、终极境界和类似概念的词汇放在这个词群里。然而，在大多数的信仰体系中，即使是无神论也仍然有至高神这样一个概念及对应的词汇。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the supreme being in the universe?
提到宇宙当中的至高者，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: God, the Lord, Yahweh, Elohim, Allah, Theos, Deus, Sky God, supreme being, supreme deity
神、主、上帝、耶和华、天公、老天、苍天、阿拉、真主、造物主、创世主、天主、玉皇大帝

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to what people believe about God?
提到人们对于神的信仰，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: theology, monotheism, polytheism, pantheism, atheism
神学、一神论、多神论、泛神论、无神论

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something to do with God?

ExampleWords.AUni: divine,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to supernatural beings--gods, spirits, other types of beings, which normally cannot be seen and do not belong to this world. Some people accept the existence of certain supernatural beings and not others. Mythological beings are those that were believed in during previous times but that are no longer believed in. Fictional beings are those that no one has ever believed in. An indication of whether most people believe in the supernatural being should be put in the definition.
把和超自然存在物有关的词放在这个词群里。超自然存在物即神、灵以及其他那些通常看不见也不属于这个世界的存在物。有些人认为有超自然体的存在，而有些人则认为没有。神话当中的事物原来的人会相信，但现在的人却不会再去相信。虚构的事物则是人们从来也不曾相信的。应当把大所数人是否相信有超自然体的存在注明在定义当中。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to supernatural beings?
通常提到超自然体，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: supernatural being, spirit
超自然体、精神体、灵体、超自然的、灵界的东西

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to lesser gods?
提到较次要的神，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: god, goddess, the gods, pantheon, deity,
女神、神女、神灵、神明、诸神、菩萨、仙、神仙、仙人、天神、娘娘、仙女、仙姑、王母

Question.AUni: (3) What types of good supernatural beings are there?
好的超自然体有哪些？

ExampleWords.AUni: angel, angelic being, cherub, seraph, saint
天使、小精灵、月老、寿星、青龙

ExampleWords.AUni: make taboo, forbid, prohibit, ban

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that is taboo?
描述应当禁忌的事情，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: taboo, forbidden, prohibited, untouchable, inviolable, banned, off-limits, avoided
禁忌的、忌讳的、避讳的、禁止的、禁戒的、应当避免的、不可做的

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the primary goal or goals of a religion, for instance in Christianity salvation from sin, death and Hell. Each religion has different beliefs about salvation. Our purpose here is not to preach or argue, but to list those words that people use to talk about this topic.
把和一种宗教最主要的目的相关的词放在这个词群里。以基督教为例，它的目的就是要拯救世人脱离罪恶、死亡和地狱。每一种宗教对于拯救都有不同的认识。我们这里的目的不是要说教或争执，而只是希望把人们在谈论这个话题时会用到的词收集起来。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to what God does to save a person?
提到神为救人所做的事，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: save, salvation, sanctify, redeem, justify, regenerate
拯救、救赎、解救、赎回、买赎、赦免…的罪、使重生、普度众生

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a person who saves another?
提到拯救别人的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: savior
救星、拯救者、救世主

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to what a person does to be saved?
提到一个人要做什么才可以得救，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: believe, repent, return (to God), receive, work, earn
信、悔改、认罪、与神和好、接受救恩、积公德、积阴德、行善积德、修行

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to dedicating someone or something to religious use.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to dedicating something to religious use?
提到把什么东西分别出来只做宗教的用途，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: dedicate, consecrate, anoint, sanctify, devote, hallow, baptize, circumcise
分别为圣、膏抹、洗礼、使神圣、献上、摆上

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that has been dedicated?
描述已经分别为圣的东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: holy, consecrated, sanctified, sacred, devoted, baptized
神圣的、属神的、圣洁的、奉献的、献上的、分别为圣的

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that has not been dedicated?
提到没有分别为圣的东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: unholy, common
不圣洁的、世俗的、属世的

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to improperly using something that has been dedicated?
提到不正确地使用了分别为圣的东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: desecrate
亵渎、玷污

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to fasting--to not eat for a period of time.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to not eating for a period of time?
提到一段时间不吃东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: fast, deny (oneself)
禁食、绝食、辟谷

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a person who denies himself for religious purposes?
提到一个出于宗教原因而克制自己的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: ascetic
禁欲者、苦修者、苦行者、苦行僧

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the general practice of denying oneself something?
通常提到克制自己这样的操练，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: asceticism
苦修、苦行

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a time when a person fasts or denies himself in some other way?
提到一个人禁食或以其它方法克制自己的这段时间，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: fast, Lent, Ramadan
禁食、吃素、吃斋、小斋、大斋、斋月

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to heaven and hell--the place where people go after they die.

Question.AUni: (1) What is the place or home of God called?
提到神居住的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: Heaven, the highest heaven, the abode of God, the throne of God
天堂、天国、天界、天园、净土、西方、西天、西方净土、极乐世界、上界

Question.AUni: (2) What is the place called where dead people are?
提到死人在的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: Hades, Sheol, the place of the dead, the grave, the other side, the beyond, underworld, nether world,
地狱、火狱、冥府、阴间、黄泉、九泉、阴曹、地府、阴曹地府、坟墓

Question.AUni: (3) What is the place called where believers (good people) go when they die?
提到信徒（好人）死后要去的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: heaven, paradise, your reward
天堂、天国、极乐世界

Question.AUni: (4) What is the place called where unbelievers (bad people) go when they die?
提到非信徒（坏人）死后要去的地方，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: hell, the pit, fire and brimstone, eternal damnation
地狱、火狱、冥府、阴间、黄泉、九泉、阴曹、地府、阴曹地府、坟墓

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to going to heaven or hell?

ExampleWords.AUni: pass on, go to heaven, go to hell

Question.AUni: (6) What words describe something belonging to heaven or hell?

ExampleWords.AUni: celestial, heavenly, hellish

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to resurrection--life after death, or living again after dying.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to coming back to life?
提到复活，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: come back to life, come back from the grave, come to life, resurrection
复活、复生、死而复生、活过来、没死、黄泉路上走了一遭、阎王爷不收

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to causing someone to come back to life?
提到使人复活，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: resurrect, raise from the dead, bring back to life, bring back from the dead
使…复活/复生/活过来、使/叫/让死人复活

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the condition or state of living forever?
提到永远活着，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: live forever, (have) eternal life, life everlasting, immortality, life after death,
永生、不死、长生不老、永恒的生命、永活

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to reincarnation?

ExampleWords.AUni: reincarnation, reincarnated,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to official religions, groups within a religion, and religious meetings. Each religion will have different names for its groups. Answer each question for each religion.
把有关正统的宗教、宗教组织和宗教集会的词放在这个词群里。每一种宗教所属的团体都会有不同的名称。针对每一种宗教回答相应的问题。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to an official religion?
通常提到正统的宗教信仰，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: religion, faith
宗教、信仰、宗教信仰

Question.AUni: (2) What are the names of the official religions?
正统的宗教信仰有哪些？

ExampleWords.AUni: Christianity, Islam, Hinduism, Judaism, animism, paganism,
基督教、犹太教、佛教、伊斯兰教、回教、道教、印度教

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a group within a religion?
提到一种宗教当中的一个群体，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: sect, denomination, party,
派别、宗派、教派、派系

Question.AUni: (4) What are the names of the sects?

ExampleWords.AUni: Catholic, Protestant, Baptist, Presbyterian, Methodist

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to a group of believers in a particular place?
提到聚在一个特殊地方的一群信徒，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: church, congregation, diocese, parish
会众、全体教徒

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to beginning to believe in a religion or changing from one religion to another?
提到开始相信一种宗教或改信一种宗教，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: convert, conversion
入教、出家、剃度、削发、洗礼、受洗、皈依、归附

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to religious practitioners--people who practice a religion, who are members of the religion, believe in the religion, leaders of the religion, and followers of the religion. Each religion has its own terms for religious practitioners. List these terms separately for each religion. The examples given below are for the Christian religion.
把和宗教人员（一种宗教的成员、领袖和追随者）有关的词放在这个词群里。每一种宗教对于相关的人员都有特殊的词来表示。下面所给出的只是和基督教有关的例子，请针对每一种宗教把相关的词列出来。

Question.AUni: (1) What is a person called who believes in a religion?
提到相信一种宗教的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: believer, member (of the faith), adherent, follower, practitioner
信徒、教徒、追随者

Question.AUni: (2) What is a person called who believes in the (Christian) religion?
提到相信（基督教）的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: Christian, brother, fellow believer, saint
（基督教）基督徒、弟兄姐妹、圣徒、追随者、（佛教）僧、僧侣、僧徒、和尚、比丘、喇嘛、沙门、沙弥、头陀、行脚僧、云游僧、行者、尼、尼姑、比丘尼、沙弥尼、僧尼、信士、信女、善男信女、居士、女居士、法师、上人、大师、禅师、大德、宗师、高僧、（道教）道士、道人、老道、羽士、黄冠、方士、炼师、高功、道长、道姑、女冠、（天主教）修士、修道士、修女、（伊斯兰教）穆斯林、穆民

Question.AUni: (3) What is a leader of the (Christian-Protestant) religion called?
提到基督教新教的带领者，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: pastor, minister, parson
（基督教）牧师、教长、教区长、长老（佛教）方丈、住持、寺主、上座、魏纳、活佛、堪布（伊斯兰教）阿訇、穆安律、伊玛目、海推布（道教）老君、天师

Question.AUni: (4) What is a leader of the (Christian-Catholic) religion called?
提到基督教天主教的带领者，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: priest, father, bishop, archbishop, Cardinal, pope, man of the cloth
（天主教）神父、神甫、主教、大主教、总主教、红衣主教、枢机主教、教皇、罗马教皇

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the profession of being a religious leader?
提到宗教带领者的职业，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: pastorate, priesthood, ministry
神职、事工

Question.AUni: (6) What words refers to all religious leaders?
提到所有的宗教带领者，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: clergy
神职人员

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to followers of a religion who are not leaders?

ExampleWords.AUni: laity, layperson, flock

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to prepared food. Cultures vary widely in the number and types of foods they prepare, and in how they classify them. For instance the English distinction between main dish and side dish is not found in the classification system of other languages. If your language has well-recognized subcategories, you can set up a separate subdomain for each. The questions below are based on the main ingredient in the dish.
把有关预制食品以及食品主要种类的词放在这个词群里。文化不同，人们准备食物的数量、种类以及对于它们分类的方法也会不同。比如英文里有主菜和辅菜的说法，而其它语言可能就不会有这样的区别。如果你的语言里有常用的更细的分类，你也可以单独建立对应的子词群。下面的问题针对的是菜的主要配料。

It is necessary to think through all the various special occasions in the culture and think of any special clothes worn on those occasions. Two examples are given below for work and graduation, but there are many others.
把有关在特殊场合上穿的服装的词放在这个词群里。需要根据各种不同的场合来考虑人们会穿的特别的衣服。下面的例子根据的只是工作和毕业两个场合，其它特殊的场合还有很多。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to clothes worn on a special occasion?
通常提到特殊场合所穿的衣服，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: sports clothes, work clothes, formal clothes, informal, office wear
运动装、猎装、工作装、工作服、职业装、学生装、校服、礼服、晚礼服、朝服、休闲服、正式服装

Question.AUni: (2) What special clothes are worn for work?
工作的时候人们会穿什么特殊的衣服？

ExampleWords.AUni: work clothes, overalls, coveralls, apron, work gloves, hardhat, steel-toed shoes, boots, goggles
工作服、连裤工作服、罩衫、手套、围裙、面罩、防护服、防护鞋、靴子、袖套

Question.AUni: (3) What special clothes are worn for graduation?
毕业的时候学生会穿什么特殊的衣服？

ExampleWords.AUni: cap and gown
博士服、博士帽、方帽

AStr.Run: Use this domain for special clothes worn by special people. It is necessary to think through all the various special types of people in the culture and think of any special clothes worn by them. Several examples are given below, but there are many others.
把表示特殊的人所穿的特殊的衣服的词放在这个词群里。需要根据不同的文化来考虑其中特殊的人会穿的特殊的衣服。下面给出了一些例子，但注意还有很多其它的词。

Question.AUni: (1) What special clothes are worn by police or soldiers?
警察和士兵会穿什么特殊的衣服？

ExampleWords.AUni: uniform, dress uniform, fatigues, camouflage, helmet, beret, cap, gasmask, braid,
军服、军装、戎装、警服、迷彩服、军衣、军裤、军鞋、军帽、贝雷帽、钢盔、防毒面具、防化服

Question.AUni: (2) What kinds of uniforms are there?
制服有哪些类型？

ExampleWords.AUni: police uniform, military uniform, nurse's uniform, band uniform
警服、军服、校服、护士服、白大褂、铁路制服

Question.AUni: (3) What special clothes are worn by religious people?
宗教信徒会穿什么特殊的衣服？

ExampleWords.AUni: habit (nun), cowl (monk), robe
袈裟（和尚）、道袍（道士）、小帽（穆斯林）、头巾（穆斯林）

Question.AUni: (4) What special clothes are worn by the king?
国王会穿什么特殊的衣服？

ExampleWords.AUni: purple cloth, crown, royal robes
龙袍、王冠、皇冠

Question.AUni: (5) What special clothes are worn by doctors?
医生会穿什么特殊的衣服？

ExampleWords.AUni: greens, surgical suit, white coat, nurses cap
白大褂、白大衣、手术服、手术帽、硅胶手套、口罩

提到脱掉衣服，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: barefoot, shoeless, shirtless, hatless, unshod, topless,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being naked--not wearing any clothes, and for words referring to how a person feels about being naked. It is a part of universal human experience that people do not want to be naked. So there are words that refer to feeling bad if one does not have enough clothes on (shame). Other words refer to wanting to have enough clothes (modest). Other words refer to how people feel about other people who do not wear enough clothes (indecent).
把关于一个人赤身露体以及这时的感觉的词放在这个词群里。哪里的人都一样，不希望自己赤身露体。所以有的词表示一个人衣不遮体时的感觉（羞耻），有的词表示一个人想要有足够的衣服穿时的感觉（不自信），而有的词则表示对于别人衣服穿得少时的感觉（猥亵）。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to being naked?
提到人光着身子，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: be naked, nakedness, nude, nudity, unclothed, nothing on, not have anything on, stripped, bare, expose (oneself)
光、赤、光赤、光溜溜、赤条条、赤裸、赤裸裸、赤露、裸、裸体、袒、袒露、裸露

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to not wearing enough clothes?
提到衣服穿得少，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: dress immodestly, immodest, impropriety, indecent
单薄、暴露、穿着不得体、不正派、下流、猥亵、前卫

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to not wanting to be naked?
提到不希望光着身子，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: modest, propriety, decent
保守、正派、规矩

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to feeling bad if you are naked?
如果光着身子，你会有什么感觉？

ExampleWords.AUni: shame, embarrassed, blush
害羞、脸红、难堪、尴尬、窘迫、羞耻、不安、不自在、不舒服

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words that refer to fire and for words referring to types of fire. These words may be specific for what is being burned (forest fire 'a fire burning a forest'), the size of the fire (inferno 'a very large hot fire'), or the place where the fire burns (hellfire 'the fire in hell').
把表示火的普通词放在这个词群里。这些词可能会表明烧的是什么东西（“森林火灾”烧的是森林），表明火的大小（“熊熊烈火”就是非常大非常热的火）以及表明着火的地方（“地狱之火”就是在地域里的火）。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to a fire?
通常提到火，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: fire, combustion,
火、焰、火焰

Question.AUni: (2) What types of fire are there?
有些什么样的火？

ExampleWords.AUni: fireball, torch, firebrand, fireworks, firecracker, burn a field before planting,
火苗、火舌、火头、火柱、火球、火种、天火、磷火、鬼火、明火、暗火、火把、火炬、焰火、烟火、烟花

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to what is being burned?
哪些火表明了烧的东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: house fire, forest fire, grass fire, wood fire, oil fire
森林大火/火灾、岩浆、燎原

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the size of the fire?
哪些火表明了火的大小？

ExampleWords.AUni: spark, flame, flicker, finger, tongue, flare, blaze, conflagration, inferno, raging inferno
火海、火龙、烈火、烈焰、文火、武火、猛火、熊熊大火/烈火、火光冲天、星火、星星之火、炽烈、炽盛、炽热、火炽、旺、旺盛、熊熊、腾腾

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to where the fire is?
哪些火表明了着火的地方？

ExampleWords.AUni: campfire, hellfire
野火、山火、营火、篝火、地域之火、火焰山

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to a fire started by accident?

ExampleWords.AUni: blaze, the flames,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to a fire started on purpose?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to harvesting crops. If there is an important crop and there are a lot of words that refer to harvesting it, set up a special domain for it, such as 'Harvest rice' or 'Harvest coconuts'. If there is more than one such crop, set up a separate domain for each of them.
把和收庄稼有关的词放在这个词群里。如果有哪种庄稼非常重要，有很多的词和收获这种庄稼有关，那么可以单独为它建立一个词群，比如“收稻谷”。如果这样的庄稼不止一种，那么就为它们单独建立各自的词群。

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words indicating the posture or stance of a person's body. Use the domains in this section for specific words for postures and for moving parts of the body. Many of these words have two meanings. One meaning is stative, indicating that the body is in a particular posture, but not moving. The other meaning is active, indicating that the person is moving his body into a particular posture. Some of these words can be used of animals or even things, if the things are perceived as being similar in posture to that of a human body.
把表示人身体姿势的词放在这个词群里。有关姿势和移动身体各部位的词放在这一部分对应的词群里。很多这样的词都有两个意思，一个是静态的，表明了身体的姿势但没有动作。另外一个是动态的，表明人正在移动身体到一个特殊的姿势。有些这样的词可以用在动物身上，甚至是被认为和人体有类似姿势的物体上。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to a person's posture?
通常提到一个人的姿势，你会怎么说？

Question.AUni: (2) What general words refer to changing your posture?

改变姿势、变换姿势、调整姿势

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to bowing to someone--to face someone and lower your head or bend at the waist so that your upper body is lowered. The words in this domain should all be symbolic acts, that is, the culture assigns a meaning and significance to the physical action. Some cultures define it as a greeting, as an act of respect, or as an act of submission. For instance in ancient middle eastern culture bowing was an act of submission done in the presence of the king. Failure to bow was an act of rebellion punishable by death. In far eastern culture it is a greeting. In African culture it is an act of respect or done to welcome a visitor. Cultures define how a person is to bow, for instance how they are to hold their hands. A person may bow while standing, or may kneel, or even prostrate himself flat on his face. Whether both people bow is also significant. The depth of the bow can have significance. In Japan the person of lower social rank must bow deeper. In European culture a performer bows to acknowledge applause.

把有关向人鞠躬（面对着一个人低头弯腰）的词放在这个词群里。这些词应当都是象征性的，即在那种文化中它们都被赋予了特定的意义和重要性。在有些地方，鞠躬表示问候、尊敬或降伏。比如在古老的中东文化当中，鞠躬在国王面前是一种臣服的表示，而没有鞠躬则会被视为一种反叛将会被处死。在远东文化中，鞠躬表示问候。在非洲文化中，鞠躬表示尊敬，用于欢迎客人。不同的文化也决定了人们要如何鞠躬，比如他们的手应该怎样握在一起。一个人可以站着鞠躬或者跪下甚至是俯伏在地上。双方是否都需要鞠躬也很重要。鞠躬的深度也有其重要性。在日本社会地位低的人必须要更深地鞠躬。在欧洲文化中，表演者对观众的掌声表示谢意也要鞠躬。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to bowing?
提到鞠躬，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: bow, bow down, bow to/before someone
鞠躬、拱手、作揖、万福、屈膝礼、哈腰、点头哈腰、欠身、折腰、打躬作揖

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe how a person bows?
描述一个人是怎么鞠躬的，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: sweeping bow, bow low, deep bow, slight bow, bow your head, his head fell, incline your head, nod, curtsy, genuflect, kowtow, prostrate, grovel
深深地、微微地、九十度、

ExampleWords.AUni: obeisance, worship, bow in submission/reverence/greeting

AStr.Run: Use this domain for intransitive verbs of movement referring to moving your whole body to a different location. There are many components of meaning involved in verbs of movement. They can include a source location (from), a goal location (to), a path (along), manner (walk, run), speed (race, crawl), direction (forward, back, side, up, down, toward, away from), shape of the path (straight, curve, circle, angle), relationship to some object or objects (on, hang, against, between, across, through, into, out of, onto, off of, around), proximity (near, far), multiple movements (back and forth, return, bounce), inclusion with other objects or parts of objects (join, leave, collect, disperse, unite, separate), volition (go versus drift), intransitive versus transitive (move versus move something). Some verbs of movement do not involve moving from one place to another, but express bodily movement.

把表示移动整个身体到另外的地方去的词放在这个词群里。这些表示移动的词意思会很丰富，其中可能包括原来的地点（移动之前）、后来的地点（移动之后）、中间的途径、方式（走、跑）、速度（快、慢）、方向（前、后、左、右、上、下、旁边）、路径的形状（直线、曲线、圆形、折线）、和其它东西之间的关系（挂、靠、在中间、穿过、进入、出来、离开、围绕）、远近、多次的移动（前后、往返、反弹）、和其它东西的联合（加入、离开、聚拢、分散、联合、解散）。有些动词没有从一个地方到另一个地方的意思，但是含有身体本身运动的意思。

移、移动、挪、挪动

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to moving toward, in the direction of, or near something or some place. The words in this domain should refer to moving in the direction of a place, but should not require that the person actually arrived. Some languages (such as German and Polish) distinguish 'go on foot' from 'go in a vehicle'.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to gathering things into a group. The basic idea of this domain involves a situation in which two or more things are not together, and someone moves them so that they are together.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to separating things into groups, and scattering things. The basic idea of this domain involves a situation in which two or more things are together, and someone moves them so that they are no longer together.
把有关将东西分散的词放在这个词群里。分散的基本概念就是两个或更多的东西原来在一起，它们被人移动之后就不在一起了。
