AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to organizing things, people, events, and ideas--to think about and decide on the pattern a group of things should be arranged in, and then doing whatever is necessary to arrange them so that they can be used for some purpose. This domain is like the domain 'Arrange' except that 'Arrange' emphasizes physically moving the things, and the domain 'Organize' emphasizes the logical system. 'Organize' does not require that the things be moved, only that the logical pattern is specified.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to organizing things?

ExampleWords.AUni: organize, dispose, structure, get together, get it together, get your act together, chart, marshal, put in a chart, put in a table, put in a matrix, sort, sort out, systematize, tabulate,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the pattern in which things are organized?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to kicking--to hit something with your foot. The words in this domain may be distinguished by the way in which the foot moves, either in a swinging motion, or by first bending the leg and then quickly straightening it. They may also be distinguished by whether the foot moves horizontally or vertically, whether the effect is to move something or damage it, or how hard the person kicks.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to cutting something.

通常提到切东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: cut,
切、割、砍、剁、劈

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to cutting something with one slice?
提到切一刀，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: slice, cut once, cut in one movement,
切、片、割、截、铡、拉、砍、斩、剁、剖、劈、划、削

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to cutting something with many slices?
提到切很多刀，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: hack, cut repeatedly
剁、乱砍/劈/割/切、猛砍/劈

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to cutting something into many pieces?
提到把东西切碎，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: cut up, cut into pieces, dice, grate, shred, cube, quarter, halve, mince, grind,
剁、切/砍剁劈碎、切/砍剁劈成碎片、肢解

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to cutting something with a swinging motion?
提到砍东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: chop
砍、斩、剁、劈

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to cutting something with a particular tool?
提到用特殊的工具砍和切，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: knife, ax
刀削/割/切/砍/劈、斧剁

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to a cut?
提到刀切开的口子，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: cut, incision
切口、伤口、口子

口、开口、缺口、孔、洞、眼、窟窿、窟窿眼

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to digging in the ground.
把有关在地上挖的词放在这个词群里。

提到挖，你会怎么说？

挖、掘、挖掘、采掘、盗掘、开挖、挖开、挖泥、挖土、挖地、开掘、掘坑、掘土、刨、刨挖、扒

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a hole dug in the ground?
提到在地上挖出来的洞，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: hole, pit, mine, excavation, tunnel, burrow, trench, ditch, shaft, foxhole, crater, cave, cavern, grotto
洞、地洞、涵洞、山洞、岩洞、窑洞、坑洞、坑、土坑、坑道、粪坑、煤坑、沙坑、石坑、陷坑、陷井、避弹坑、散兵坑、矿井、隧道、隧洞、地窖、井、水井、盐井、石窟、猫耳洞、防空洞、地道、掩体

Question.AUni: (3) What tools and machines are used to dig?
挖掘需要用什么工具？

ExampleWords.AUni: shovel, spade, hoe, pickaxe, steam shovel, bulldozer, backhoe
锄、锄头、鹤嘴锄、镐、镐头、洋镐、铲、铲子、泥铲、铁铲、锹、铁锹、挖土机、挖掘机、铲土机、推土机

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe the size of a hole in the ground?
描述坑的尺寸，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: deep, shallow, narrow, wide
大、小、宽、窄、深、浅

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to putting something in a hole and covering it up?
提到把什么东西放在坑里然后盖起来，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: bury
埋、掩埋、埋起来、葬、埋葬、土葬、埋藏

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to something breaking or wearing out, especially for things that people make and use.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to something breaking?

ExampleWords.AUni: break, bust, give out,

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that has broken?

ExampleWords.AUni: broken, broken down, busted

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to something wearing out?

ExampleWords.AUni: wear, wear out, deteriorate,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something that is worn?

ExampleWords.AUni: used, well used, worn, well worn, is past its prime, second hand

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe something that has been used so much that it is no longer useful?

ExampleWords.AUni: worn out, has had it, is past it,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to damaging something--to do something bad to something, but not completely ruin it so that it can't be used any more.
把有关损坏什么东西（不完全摧毁什么东西，只是搞破坏让它不能再使用）的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to damaging something?
提到损坏什么东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: damage, do damage, cause damage, break, bust, chip, corrode, corrupt, deface, dent, erode, harm, do harm, hurt, impair, injure, maltreat, mar, mess up, nick, sabotage, score, scratch, spoil, vandalize,
损坏、损伤、损害、伤害、破坏、毁坏、毁损

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to deliberately damaging something?

ExampleWords.AUni: vandalize, vandal, smash up, sabotage, tamper with, deface, desecrate,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to something being damaged over a long period of time?

ExampleWords.AUni: wear away, corrode, erode,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to using something for a long time until it is damaged?

ExampleWords.AUni: wear away, wear out,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the act of damaging something?

ExampleWords.AUni: corrosion, detriment, erosion, maltreatment, mischief, vandalism,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the damage done to something?

ExampleWords.AUni: damage (n), scar, wear (n), wear and tear,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to a person who damages things?

ExampleWords.AUni: vandal, saboteur, bull in a china shop,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to something that damages things?

ExampleWords.AUni: blight,

Question.AUni: (9) What words describe something that damages things?

ExampleWords.AUni: harmful, toxic, toxicity, unwholesome, dangerous,

Question.AUni: (10) What words refer to something that has been damaged?

ExampleWords.AUni: breakages, damaged goods,

Question.AUni: (11) What words describe something that has been damaged?

ExampleWords.AUni: spoiled, broken, busted, messed up, damaged, crumbling, moth-eaten,

Question.AUni: (12) What words describe something that can be damaged easily?

ExampleWords.AUni: vulnerable,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to tearing down buildings and other structures.
把和拆毁楼房及其它建筑物有关的词放在这个词群里。

提到拆毁什么东西，你会怎么说？

拆、拆毁、拆除、拆散、拆卸、推翻、铲除

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to destroying something--to damage something so that it is beyond repair and cannot be used.
把和摧毁什么东西（完全地破坏）有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to destroying something?
提到摧毁什么东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: destroy, blow up, hose (v), ruin, total (v), wreck, blow up, burn down,
毁、毁掉、摧毁、捣毁、销毁、炸毁、烧毁、焚毁、毁灭、破坏、毁弃

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to something being destroyed?

ExampleWords.AUni: fall down, collapse, be blown down,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the act or process of destroying something?

ExampleWords.AUni: destruction, ruin,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to someone or something that destroys things?

ExampleWords.AUni: destroyer,

Question.AUni: (5) What words describe someone of something that destroys things?

ExampleWords.AUni: destructive,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to something that has been destroyed?

ExampleWords.AUni: ruin, wreck, wreckage, shipwreck,

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe something that has been destroyed?

修、修补、修理、修造、修整、修配、修复、修缮、维修、整修、大修、翻修、检修、抢修

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general words refer to the state or condition of something.
把表示什么东西状况和情况的普通词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to the state or condition of something?
通常提到什么东西的状况，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: state, condition, shape, position,
情形、状况、情况、境况、境地

AStr.Run: What <state> is your house in?; My house is in bad <shape>.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate the state that something is in?

ExampleWords.AUni: be, fare, stand,

AStr.Run: How are you <faring>?; How do things <stand> at work?
Use this domain for general words referring to the amount or quantity of something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the amount of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: amount, quantity, level, volume, percentage, proportion, sum, how much, ($100) worth,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the amount of something that can be counted?

ExampleWords.AUni: number, how many, numbers, ratio,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the amount of food that someone is given?

ExampleWords.AUni: portion, helping, serving, intake, ration, measure,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a measured amount of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: quota, load,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the amount of something, such as fuel, that is available to be used?

ExampleWords.AUni: pool, stock, reserves,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the amount of medicine that a sick person needs?

ExampleWords.AUni: dose, dosage,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to the amount of a problem such as crime or damage?

ExampleWords.AUni: extent, incidence, level, rate,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to numbers. Every language has a word for 'one', and a word for 'two'. These two numbers often have special words. So we have included a separate domain for 'one' and 'two'. In addition the numbers form a series (one, two, three...). Most languages have more than one series of numbers (first, second, third...). So we have also included a domain for each series of numbers that most languages have. Your language may have other series of numbers. Put them in the domain 'Number series'.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a written number?

ExampleWords.AUni: number, figure, digit, numeral,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a number of people or things?

ExampleWords.AUni: toll, statistics,

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe different kinds of numbers?

ExampleWords.AUni: even, odd, positive, negative, infinite, cardinal, ordinal, whole, fraction, decimal,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to writing numbers on a series of things?

ExampleWords.AUni: number (v), numbered,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that there are a particular number of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: number (v),

AStr.Run: The group <numbered> fifty.
Use this domain for words related to the cardinal numbers (one, two, three)--the numbers used to count.

Question.AUni: (1) What are the cardinal numbers? (the numbers you use when you count)
哪些是基数？（你数数的时候用的数）

ExampleWords.AUni: zero, one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen...
一、壹、幺、二、贰、两、三、叁、四、肆、五、伍、六、陆、七、柒、八、捌、九、玖、十、拾、十一、十二、十三…

Question.AUni: (2) multiples of ten
十的倍数

ExampleWords.AUni: ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty, ninety
十、二十、廿、念、三十、卅、四十、卌、五十、六十、七十、八十、九十…

Question.AUni: (3) multiples of one hundred
百的倍数

ExampleWords.AUni: one hundred, two hundred
百、佰、一百、二/两百、三百、四百、五百…

Question.AUni: (4) multiples of one thousand
千的倍数

ExampleWords.AUni: one thousand, two thousand
千、仟、一千、二/两千、三千、四千、五千…

Question.AUni: (5) numbers larger than one thousand
比千大的数

ExampleWords.AUni: million, billion, trillion, quadrillion
万、十万、百万、兆、千万、亿、十亿、百亿、千亿、万亿

Question.AUni: (6) What words are used to refer to the numbers of a certain decimal place?
提到特定的十进制数位，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: the digits, the tens, hundreds, thousands, millions, billions, trillions
位、位数、个、个位、十位、百位、千位、万位、十万位…

Question.AUni: (7) What words are used to refer to groups of a certain decimal place?
提到特定的一组十进制数位，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: tens, hundreds, thousands, tens of thousands, millions, billions, trillions
数十、数百、数千、数万、数十万、数百万…

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to a very large number?

ExampleWords.AUni: huge number, myriad, zillion, jillion, umpteen, googolplex,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to an unlimited number?

ExampleWords.AUni: infinity, infinite, boundless, endless, limitless,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the number one. It appears that every language has a word for 'one' and 'two', but not every language has a word for the numbers higher than two. Many languages have several words that mean 'one'.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to one?

ExampleWords.AUni: one, first, individual, single, only, the one, one apiece, one each,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to being by yourself?

ExampleWords.AUni: alone, by yourself, sole,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to doing something by yourself?

ExampleWords.AUni: alone, on your own, solo, solely,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to people doing something one by one?

ExampleWords.AUni: one by one, singly, individually,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate that something happens or is done one time?

ExampleWords.AUni: once, one time, single time, one-off,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the number two.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to two?

ExampleWords.AUni: two, second, two times, two-fold, double (v), twins, brace, dichotomy, deuce, dual, dyad, twain, yoke, in pairs, in twos, two by two, by twos, two at a time, two apiece, two each, both, either, neither,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to two people who do things together?

ExampleWords.AUni: couple, pair, duo, twosome, duet,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to two things that are used together?

ExampleWords.AUni: pair, twin,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to something used by two people?

ExampleWords.AUni: for two, double, two-man,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to something with two parts?

ExampleWords.AUni: double (adj), couplet, duplex,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to something used for two things?

ExampleWords.AUni: dual, twofold,

Question.AUni: (7) What words indicate that something is two times the amount of something else?

ExampleWords.AUni: twice, double, twice as much (as), two times as much (as), two times what, double what,

Question.AUni: (8) What words indicate that something happens or is done two times?

ExampleWords.AUni: twice, twice over, two-time,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to the ordinal numbers (first, second, third)--the numbers used to indicate the order of something in a series, such as "the first child".

Question.AUni: (1) What are the ordinal numbers?

ExampleWords.AUni: first, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seven, eighth, ninth, tenth, eleventh, twelfth, thirteenth, hundredth, thousandth,

AStr.Run: My parents had five boys and I am the <second>.; This book is the <third> in the series.

Use this domain for numbers that refer to the number of times something happens or is done. These numbers may be adverbs as in English (twice) or in some languages they may be verbs (to do something two times).
把和次数（事情发生或被做了多少次）有关的词放在这个词群里。这些数字在有些语言里可能是副词（比如在英语中），而在其它的语言里则有可能是动词（做什么事情做了几次）。

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate the number of times something has happened? ("He fell down three times.")

ExampleWords.AUni: once, one time, single time, twice, two times, three times, thrice, four times, many times

AStr.Run: Mary washed the dress <three times>.; I have lent John money <many times>.; I have lent John money <twice>.

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that has happened a particular number of times?

ExampleWords.AUni: two-time, three-time,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to doing something a particular number of times (to do something once/twice/etc.)?

ExampleWords.AUni: (none in English)

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to multiples of something (single, double, triple).

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that is two or three times the amount of something else?

ExampleWords.AUni: single (portion, scoop), double (adj), triple, quadruple, quintuple, two-fold, three-fold, four-fold,

AStr.Run: The oldest son inherited a <double> portion.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is two or three times the amount of something else?

ExampleWords.AUni: twice as much (as), two times as much (as), two times what, double what,

AStr.Run: He gave you <three times what> he gave me.; He gave you <three times as much as> he gave me.

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to something becoming two or three times as much?

ExampleWords.AUni: double (vi), triple, quadruple,

AStr.Run: The size of our herd <doubled> in three years.

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to making something become two or three times as much?

ExampleWords.AUni: double (vt), triple, treble, quadruple,

AStr.Run: My boss <doubled> my salary.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to counting--to say the numbers in order, or to use numbers to find an amount.

ExampleWords.AUni: estimate, assess, reckon,

ExampleWords.AUni: miscalculate, miscount, lose count,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the number or amount of something that is counted?

ExampleWords.AUni: calculation, sum, estimate, estimation, count (n),

ExampleWords.AUni: number, assign a number, count off

Question.AUni: (8) What words describe an amount that cannot be counted?
形容什么东西数不清，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: innumerable, unnumbered, uncountable, uncounted, countless,
无数、数不清、数不尽、数不过来、不计其数、多不胜数、不可胜数、不知凡几

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to mathematics and arithmetic--the study of numbers.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to mathematics?

ExampleWords.AUni: mathematics, math, arithmetic, geometry, algebra, calculus, trigonometry, statistics,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to determining the amount of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: calculate, work out, figure out, make, figure, compute, solve,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate the answer in an equation?

ExampleWords.AUni: is, equals, get,

AStr.Run: Two plus two <is> four.; Two added to two <equals> four.; If you add two and two, you <get> four.

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the answer to a mathematical problem?

ExampleWords.AUni: answer, solution,

Question.AUni: (5) What words are used to talk about mathematics?

把表示一个数字或尺寸是准确还是近似的词放在这个词群里。近似值会和‘时间位置’、‘空间位置’、‘逻辑位置’、‘尺寸’或‘数字’同时出现。

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe a number or amount that is approximate?

ExampleWords.AUni: approximate, rough,

AStr.Run: We need to know the <approximate> weight of his suitcase.

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that is not exact?

ExampleWords.AUni: inexact, inaccurate, sort of, kind of,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that a particular number or amount is approximate?

ExampleWords.AUni: about, approximately, roughly, give or take, at a guess, somewhere in the region of, an estimated, some, something like, in round numbers, close to,

AStr.Run: It weighs <about> four kilos.; John walks <approximately> two miles a day.

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly more?

ExampleWords.AUni: or so, odd, or more, at least, and maybe more, barely, hardly, little more than, scarcely,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly less?

ExampleWords.AUni: at most, as much as, short of,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to determining the approximate number of amount of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: approximate (v), estimate (v), overestimate, underestimate,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to estimating a number to the nearest ten, hundred, thousand, etc?

ExampleWords.AUni: rounded to the nearest ten/hundred/thousand, round up, round down,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to a number that is approximate?

ExampleWords.AUni: estimate (n), approximation, ballpark figure, round figure,

Question.AUni: (9) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate time?

ExampleWords.AUni: about, around, approximately, round about, or thereabouts, circa, some time,

Question.AUni: (10) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate place?

ExampleWords.AUni: about, around, in the vicinity of, near, close to,

Question.AUni: (11) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?

ExampleWords.AUni: narrowly, rather,

Question.AUni: (12) What words indicate that something is done in approximately the right way?

ExampleWords.AUni: roughly, more or less, somewhat,

Question.AUni: (13) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?

ExampleWords.AUni: loose, vague, hazy, impressionistic, broad,

提到平均数，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: average (adj), mean (adj), medium (adj), medial, on average,

ExampleWords.AUni: average (v), average out,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing a whole thing--all of something with no parts missing.

ExampleWords.AUni: complete, make up, assemble,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that something is not whole?

ExampleWords.AUni: incomplete, partial, missing something,

AStr.Run: Many things have parts. Use this domain for words referring to a part of something, and for words that express the idea that something has parts, that something is a part of something, or that link the whole with a part.
很多东西都有不同的组成部分。把表示某个东西有组成部分、某个东西是另外的东西的一部分或用一部分连起整体的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to a part of something?
提到什么东西的一部分，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: part, bit, portion, section, segment, sample, cross-section, member,
部、部分、局部、地方、点、分支、部门

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the parts that something is made from?

ExampleWords.AUni: component, element, piece, ingredient, constituent

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to the parts of a process?

ExampleWords.AUni: stage, phase, round,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the parts of an organization?

ExampleWords.AUni: branch, department, division, section, sector, wing, end, subdivision,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to the parts of a story?

ExampleWords.AUni: episode, installment, chapter, scene, part, extract, excerpt, clip,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the parts of a situation?

ExampleWords.AUni: aspect, side, dimension, facet, factor, feature, detail,

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to being a part of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: be part of, form a part of, inherent,

Question.AUni: (8) What words indicate that something has parts?
哪些词表示某个东西有不同的组成部分？

ExampleWords.AUni: have, of, -'s, consist of, be made of, be made up of, be composed of, comprise, be divided into, include
有、…的、是…的一部分、由…组成/构成、包含

AStr.Run: Many animals <have> four feet.; The story <is composed of> several episodes.; This page <is part of> that document.; the wheel <of> the car; the boy<'s> foot

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words related to being or having enough--to have as much of something or as many of something as you need or want.

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe something that you have enough of?

ExampleWords.AUni: enough, sufficient, adequate, satisfactory, enough to go round,

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that there is enough of something for what you need?

ExampleWords.AUni: be enough, do, suffice, cover, last, meet someone's needs, get by, afford to,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that someone is strong enough or old enough to do something?

ExampleWords.AUni: enough, sufficiently

AStr.Run: John <is> strong enough to walk now.

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe a situation in which someone does enough or something happens enough?

ExampleWords.AUni: do enough, sufficiently, adequacy, adequately, satisfactorily, sufficiency,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to having enough of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: have enough, be OK for, be all right for, be well off for, have sufficient,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to having enough of something to do what you want?

ExampleWords.AUni: have the time/money, can afford, can spare, run to,

AStr.Run: John <has> the money to buy a bicycle.

Question.AUni: (7) What words refer to having more than enough, but not too much?

ExampleWords.AUni: more than enough, plenty, ample,

Question.AUni: (8) What words refer to not having enough?

ExampleWords.AUni: not enough, insufficient, too little, too few, scarce, inadequate, inadequacy, shortage, lack of, be in short supply, be short,

Question.AUni: (9) What words indicate that there is not enough of something for what you need?

ExampleWords.AUni: not be enough, be running short, not last, won't last,

Question.AUni: (10) What words indicate that someone is not strong enough or old enough to do something?

ExampleWords.AUni: not (strong) enough, not sufficiently,

Question.AUni: (11) What words describe a situation in which someone does not do enough or something does not happens enough?

ExampleWords.AUni: not...enough, too little,

Question.AUni: (12) What words refer to not having enough of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: not have enough, be short of, be short on, go short, be running short of, deficient, be starved of, be lacking in,

Question.AUni: (13) What words refer to not having enough of something to do what you want?

ExampleWords.AUni: not have enough, can't afford, be strapped for cash,

AStr.Run: <How far> is New York from Washington?; <What is the distance> from New York to Washington?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something, such as a tool or way of doing something, that is proper for a particular time, place, purpose, or job. The words in this domain involve a comparison between two things, an item and a setting. An evaluation is made as to how good the item is in the setting. The words may be used only of certain types of items, certain types of settings, or certain types of usefulness.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing the appearance of something that has pleasing aspects or inspires awe and wonder in the viewer. For instance, the palace of a king, the home of a rich man, or a temple may be elaborately decorated and be described as glorious or magnificent. Or something in nature such as a sunset or flower may inspire awe and wonder.
把描述具有吸引人的外表或让观看者感到惊奇或敬畏的事物的词放在这个词群里。比如皇帝的宫殿、富人的豪宅、精心装饰的庙宇。还有比如自然当中的落日和鲜花都可能让人感到惊奇和敬畏。

提到什么东西会永远继续，你会怎么说？

AStr.Run: It is now five <o'clock>.; It is five <a.m.>; It is five <p.m.>; It is noon <time>.; ten minutes <after> five.; <half> <past> five.; a <quarter> <to> five.; at ten <of> six.; a <quarter> <of> an hour.; in <half> an hour.; ten minutes <past> <the hour>.

Use this domain for words referring to temporal order or sequence--the order in which a group of events happen. Things and people may also be in order based on the order in which something happened or should happen to them.

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the order or sequence of a group of events?

ExampleWords.AUni: order, sequence, cycle, pattern, rota, order of events,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a group of events that happen in order?

ExampleWords.AUni: sequence, series, succession, chain, course, progression,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a group of things in a series?

ExampleWords.AUni: series, lineup, queue,

描述一个群体很有次序，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: be in order, ordered, in sequence, be the right way round, in chronological order, chronological, consecutive, consecutively, successive, in succession, one after another, one after the other, (three years) running, sequential,
整齐、规则、有序、有规则、有规律、匀整、匀齐、井井有条、有条不紊

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to doing things in order?

ExampleWords.AUni: in order, take turns,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to the particular order in which something comes?
提到事物出现的特定的次序，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: place, position, where something comes,
首先、起先、开初、开头、起初、最初、当初、一开始、然后、之后、稍后、接下来、接下去、接着、最后、最终、终于、末了

Question.AUni: (7) What words describe a group of things that have not been put in order?
描述一个群体没有次序，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: unordered, out of sequence
杂乱、杂乱无章、无序、错乱、错落、参差、参差不齐、乱、凌乱、乱糟糟

Question.AUni: (8) What words describe a group of things in the wrong order?

ExampleWords.AUni: be out of order, be in the wrong order, be the wrong way round, backwards,

Question.AUni: (9) What words refer to something missing from a group of things in order?
提到在有序的一个群体当中所缺少的一个部分，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: gap
空、缺、空缺、缺失、缺口、隙、间隙

Question.AUni: (10) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a noun phrase with no overt marker.
在汉语中，“次序”可以用没有明显标记的名词短语来表示。

AStr.Run: the first child; the second taxi; the next person (to speak); the last person (out the door)

Question.AUni: (11) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a 'be' clause with the 'Item' in the subject position.
在汉语里，“次序”可以用“事物”作主语加“是”的句子来表达。

ExampleWords.AUni: be,

AStr.Run: This child <was> first.

Question.AUni: (12) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the 'Item' marked by 'of'.
在汉语里，“次序”可以用“事物”加“中的…”名词短语构成。

ExampleWords.AUni: of,
中的…

AStr.Run: the second <of> the winners

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something happening often--happening or done many times.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate how often something happens?

ExampleWords.AUni: often, frequently, time after time, time and again, repeatedly, many a time, hundreds of times, half the time, at frequent intervals,

AStr.Run: Mary <often> washes the dress.; I have <frequently> lent John money.

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe something that happens often?

ExampleWords.AUni: frequent, repeated, habitual,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that something does not happen often?

ExampleWords.AUni: rarely, infrequently,

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe something that does not happen often?

ExampleWords.AUni: rare, infrequent,

Question.AUni: (5) What words indicate how often something happens?

ExampleWords.AUni: how often, how many times, the number of times, frequency,

Question.AUni: (6) What words refer to something happening more often?

ExampleWords.AUni: increasingly,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something happening all the time.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something happens or a situation exists all the time?

ExampleWords.AUni: all the time, always, constantly, permanently, permanent
始终、时刻、随时、每时每刻、无时无刻、从来、向来、素来、历来、自来、一向、一直、从小、生来、总、总是、不断

整天、整日、整夜、整个晚上、整个礼拜、从头到尾、从头至尾、从早到晚

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to something happening every time something else happens.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something always happens?

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that something happens every day or week?

ExampleWords.AUni: every (day),

AStr.Run: John waters his cows <every> evening.
Use this domain for words that indicate that something that never happens, or that something has not once happened.

持续、延续、接续、接连、蝉联、此起彼伏、继往开来、承上启下、承前启后、一脉相传/承、连连、一连、陆续、相继、不断、不迭、连天、联翩、绵绵、源源、络绎、络绎不绝、接二连三、传、续、流传、继承、承接

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to something that continues?

ExampleWords.AUni: continuum,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to interrupting someone--speaking when someone is speaking, or doing something to stop someone from doing what they are doing.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to the speed at which a person acts or the speed at which something happens.

提到人做动作的速度，你会怎么说？

Use this domain for words referring to doing something at a quick speed or something happening quickly.
把和做事情快或事情发生地快有关的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words describe an action that is done quickly?
描述动作快，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: fast, quick, quickly, quickness, speedy, speeding, speedily, speed, hasty, hastily, haste, rapid, rapidly, rapidity, hurry, hurried, hurriedly, in a hurry, swift, swiftly, swiftness, rush, rush into, rush through, in a rush, express
快、快速、迅速、速、迅、速度快

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe an action that is done extremely quickly?
描述动作非常快，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: at light speed, faster than a speeding bullet, just a blur
火速、飞、飞速、飞快、迅疾、一溜烟、急、急速、急遽、急骤、急促、急剧、迅急、迅猛、健步、风驰电掣、

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that happens quickly?
描述事情发生地很快，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: happen so fast, in the twinkling of an eye, came and went so quickly, it was all over in a minute

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to doing something quickly?
提到做什么事情速度快，你会怎么说？

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to causing someone to do something quickly?
提到使某人快点做什么事情，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: hurry (someone), rush (someone)
催、促、催促、敦促、督促

Question.AUni: (6) What do you say to someone when you want him to hurry?
如果想让某人赶快做什么事情，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: Hurry up! Move it! Let's go, let's go! Quick! Faster! Speed it up! Get a move on! Giddy up! (horse)
赶快、赶紧、加油、快点、快一点、别磨蹭了

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to doing something at a slow speed.

描述动作慢，你会怎么说？

慢、缓、缓慢、迟、迟缓、迂缓、慢腾腾、慢吞吞、慢慢腾腾、慢慢吞吞、慢悠悠、慢慢悠悠、徐徐、慢条斯理、老年破车

Question.AUni: (2) What words describe an action that is done extremely slowly?

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to causing someone to do something slowly?

ExampleWords.AUni: slow (someone) down, hold back, restrain, delay, hold up

Question.AUni: (5) What do you say to someone when you want him to do something slowly?

ExampleWords.AUni: Slow down! Take it easy! Take your time! Whoa! (horse)

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a sudden event--something happens that I don't expect.

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to the suddenness of something?

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that refer to the place where something is located and for words indicating the location of something.

位、位置、地位、地方、地点

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is located somewhere?

ExampleWords.AUni: be at, at, be, be located, location
在、位于、…的位置在、坐落于/在、…的

AStr.Run: John <is at> home.; John <is> here.; The books <are> in the box.; The office <is located> in the next building.; The <location> of the library <is> in the Academic Building.; Here <is> John.; There <are> the potatoes.; the steps <at> the door
Use this domain for words that refer to a place in relation to the speaker or listener.

这里、这儿、这边、这搭、这个地方、此间、这附近

提到靠近听话人的地方，你会怎么说？

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that two things are touching or in contact with each other.

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something is next to something else.

提到面对着某个方向，你会怎么说？

Question.AUni: (2) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a clause using the verb 'contain' with the 'Container' in the subject position and the 'Content' in the object position.
在汉语里，“容纳”可以用“容器”作主语加动词“装着”再加“内容”作宾语的句子来表达。

AStr.Run: The cup <contained> milk.

Question.AUni: (3) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a clause using the verb with the 'Container' in the subject position, the 'Content' in the object position, and the 'Container' in a preposition phrase marked by 'in'.

AStr.Run: The cup <has> milk <in it>.

Question.AUni: (4) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the 'Container' as the head and the 'Content' marked by 'of'.

AStr.Run: the <container> <of> milk

Question.AUni: (6) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the word 'contents' as the head and the 'Container' marked by 'of'.
在汉语里，“容纳”可以用“容器”加“…里的…‘内容’”这样的名词短语来表达。

AStr.Run: the <contents> <of> the cup

Question.AUni: (7) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a possession phrase with the 'Container' in the first position and the word 'contents' in the second position.

AStr.Run: the cup<'s> <contents>

AStr.Run: Use the following section for words that don't belong in any other domain because they are so general in meaning that you can use them to talk about any topic. Use this domain for general and indefinite words that can be used in the place of any word. Some languages have a general word that can replace a noun or a verb. For instance some Philippine languages use the word 'kwan' in this way. Colloquial German can use the word 'dings' as a noun or verb. Often these words are used when you can't remember the particular word you are trying to think of. In English we use the word 'blank' when we don't want to say a word, for instance when we are testing someone and want them to say the word.

有些词的意思非常普通，谈论任何话题你都可以用得上。把这些不属于其它任何词群的词放在下面这个部分里。把那些普通的，意义不是很明确的可以用来替代任何其它词的词放在这个词群里。在有些语言当中会有一个普通词可以用来替代一个名词或动词。比如，在菲律宾的一些语言当中“kwan”就可以这样来使用。在德语的口语中可以用“dings”来当作一个名词或动词。通常人们使用这些词是因为不能确切地记起想要使用的那个词。在英语里，如果不想说出某个词的时候，人们会使用“blank”（空）。比如在对某个人进行测试看看他能不能说出那个词。

Question.AUni: (1) What words can be used in the place of any word?
哪个词可以用来替代其它任何的词？

ExampleWords.AUni: blank, ... (ellipsis), you know what I mean
什么、什么什么、某某某、某人、某物

AStr.Run: Many languages have general words that indicate some kind of state. These general words may be used with a wide variety of specific meanings. For instance in English the word 'be' may be used to identify something, describe something, and many other ideas.
很多语言都会有一些普通词用来指出某种状态。这些普通词使用的时候可以有很多特定的意思。比如，在英语当中“be”可以用来确定某样东西、描述某样东西以及其它很多的概念。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to something being something?

ExampleWords.AUni: be, represent, amount to, form, make, constitute

AStr.Run: Your idea <is> good.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is being identified?
哪些词表示某个东西被识别出来？

ExampleWords.AUni: is
是

AStr.Run: John <is> our new leader.; This <is> a pine tree.

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that a group of things is something?

ExampleWords.AUni: make up, form, constitute, add up to,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating that something exists.

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate that something exists?
哪些词表示存在什么东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: exist, existence, there is, there exists, there lives, be, be found, occur, be in existence, be in operation, real,
有、存、存在、存活、活着、住着

AStr.Run: <There is> a man....; <There was> a man....; <There exists> evidence....; Evidence <exists>....; God <exists>.; I think, therefore I <am>.; Once upon a time <there lived> a man....

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to something starting to exist?

ExampleWords.AUni: appear, arise, coalesce, come into being, come into existence, come to be, develop, emerge, form, materialize, spring up, take shape

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to continuing to exist?

ExampleWords.AUni: remain, persist, persistence, survive, survival, survivor,

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to something ceasing to exist?

ExampleWords.AUni: become extinct, extinction, die out, disappear, vanish, cease to exist, disappearance, disintegrate, disintegration, fade, loss,

Question.AUni: (5) What words refer to not existing?

ExampleWords.AUni: non-existent, extinct, there's no, there's no such thing,

AStr.Run: Many languages have general words that indicate some kind of change of state. These general words may be used with a wide variety of specific meanings. For instance in English the word 'become' may be used to a change in identity, a change in characteristic, a change in nature, and many other ideas.
很多语言都会有一些普通词用来指出状态的某种变化。这些普通词使用的时候可以有很多特定的意思。比如，在英语中“become”（变）可以用来指出一种身份的改变、特征的改变、本质的改变以及其它很多方面的改变。

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate a change of state?
要指出某种状态的改变，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: become (characteristic), change, come to be, turn, get, develop, grow into, turn into, change into, become different, evolve
变、变成、成为、转变成、变为、化、进化、演变、演化、衍变、演进、好

AStr.Run: John <became> president last year.; The sky <turned> red as the sun set.; After a long illness, John finally <got> better.

Question.AUni: (2) What words are used of causing or producing a state?
提到造成或导致了某种状态，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: produce, cause to be, make to be, make, make into, result in, bring upon, bring about
使、使得、让、叫、教、令、致使、促使、导致、造成、带来

AStr.Run: He <made> me angry.

Question.AUni: (3) What words are used of attaining a state?
提到达到某种状态，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: come to be, attain, achieve, reach
有、到、达到、进入

AStr.Run: He <reached> the age of 100.

Many languages have several general words that are used to indicate a variety of relationships between two things. There are three such words in English: "have," "of," and the possessive suffix "-'s." The basic meaning of these words in English is 'to own', but they can mean many other things too. For instance they can mean that I am related to someone (I have a brother), something has a part (birds have wings), and many other ideas. There is also a set of pronouns in English that are like nouns ending in -'s (my/mine, your/yours, his, her/hers, its, our/ours, their/theirs, whose). Use this domain for these general words.
很多语言当中都有一个用来连系两个名词的普通词。一个词作“中心名词”，另外一个的地位则稍微次要一些，这样它们在一起就可以构成一个名词短语。这样的结构能够表达相当广泛意思。在日语中这个词是“no”。在班图语里它则是一个词根“-a”，可以加上和中心名词和谐对应的一系列前缀。在希腊柯因内语里它是一个词缀“-os”，被添加在处于次要地位的那个名次后面。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words relate two nouns?
哪个普通词可以连系两个名词？

ExampleWords.AUni: have, of, -'s
…的

AStr.Run: Own: John <has> a house (to sell), the house <of> John, John<'s> house, hi<s> house, who<se> house (is this?), the house is hi<s>; Kinship: John <has> a brother, the brother <of> John, John<'s>brother, hi<s> brother; Relationship: John <has> a friend, the friend <of> John, John<'s> friend, a friend of hi<s>; Member: The school <has> (a hundred) students, the students <of> the school, the school<'s> students; Part: Trees <have> leaves, the leaves <of> the tree, the tree<'s> leaves, it<s> leaves; Name: John <has> three names, the three names <of> John, John<'s> three names, hi<s> names; Know: John <has> the answer, John<'s> answer, hi<s> answer; Hold: John <has> the key (in his pocket), John<'s> key, hi<s> key; Feel: John <has> anger, the anger <of> John, John's anger, hi<s> anger; Sickness: John <has> cancer, John<'s> cancer, hi<s> cancer; Located on: The yard <has> a fence, the yard<'s> fence; Be pictured in: the photo <of> John, John<'s> photo, hi<s> photo; Quality: John <has> status, the status <of> John, John<'s> status, hi<s> status; Use: The secretary <has> a computer, the computer <of> the secretary, the secretary<'s> computer, the computer is her<s>; Event: the arrival <of> John, John<'s> arrival, hi<s> arrival

Attributes often belong to a class of attributes (shape = straight, curved) or to a scale (length = long, short). The class or scale can sometimes be included in the expression, but does not mark the proposition itself. (The towel <feels> damp. The box <weighs> five kilos.)
属性通常属于特征的一类（形状=直、弯）或一种等级（长度=长、宽）。特征或等级有时可以包含在表述中，但并不标明命题本身。（这条毛巾<摸上去是>湿的。这只箱子<有>五公斤<重>。）

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate an attribute of something?
哪些词可以表明事物的特征？

ExampleWords.AUni: found to be, discover to be, turn out to be, be in many ways
是、有、的、具有、具有的、处于、在

AStr.Run: <be> characteristic, state; <have> condition; <bear> characteristic; <be in a state of> characteristic; The dirt <is> red.; The towel <is> damp.; This man <is> important.; This man <has> an important status.; The towel<'s> dampness.; The dampness <of> the towel.; The damp state <of> this towel.

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate a point on a scale?

AStr.Run: The box <weighs> five kilos.

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate an evaluation of something?

AStr.Run: That woman <is> beautiful.
Use this domain for general verbs with a volitional subject (agent).
把表示主语出于一种意志而有的行为的普通动词放在这个词群里。

做、干、做事、弄、操、搞、整、为、办事、行事、行、动手、着手、下手、上手、从事

事、事情、事物、事项、事宜、坏事、勾当、劣迹、憾事、恨事、往事、旧事、遗事、轶事、事迹、成绩、功绩、业绩、琐事、杂事、杂务、任务、工作

ExampleWords.AUni: achiever, actor, doer, performer, agent
实干家、行动家、执行者、经办人

Question.AUni: (4) What words describe someone who is doing something?
描述正在做事情的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: active, in action

问别人在做什么，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: What are you doing? What are you up to? What do you think you are doing?
你在干嘛/什么？你在做什么？在忙什么？正忙着呢？

ExampleWords.AUni: event, experience, affair, occurrence, phenomenon, occasion,

把和对什么事情做出反应的普通词放在这个词群里。

提到反应，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: react, respond,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to someone changing something.

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to refer to changing something?
提到改变什么东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: change (v), change (n), revise, revision, revolutionize, revolution, reform, reformation, modify, modification, develop, development, make different, impact, process, transform,
改、变、改变、转变、转、转化、变为、变更、变动、改动、更动、扭转、移、易、变换、改换、更改、更换、改善、改良、改进、改革、革新、维新、改辙、改制、变法、整改、正本清源、除旧布新、兴利除弊、改弦更张、改弦易辙、革命、改版、改编、改写、篡改、窜改、悔改、删改、涂改、修改、改行、改造

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that indicate event propositions. Event propositions are similar in that they are normally expressed by a subject and a verb, possibly including an object, indirect object, or complement clause. However there are multiple ways in which a language can express an event, such as a passive construction, noun phrase, or subordinate clause. In addition each event type is different in its primary cases, and in the ways those cases are marked. Each event type has subtypes, such as intransitive, transitive, and bitransitive verbs. A great deal of research is needed in order to identify all the variations. Ultimately every verb must be investigated to determine how it behaves in each syntactic construction and how its case relations are marked. No two verbs are entirely alike.
把标明“活动事件”、“行动者”、“被动者”以及“被动者的接受者”的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate an event?

ExampleWords.AUni: -ing, -'s...-ing, -ing...of, to,

AStr.Run: A bark<ing> dog (kept me awake last night).; The dog<'s> bark<ing> (woke me up).; The bark<ing> <of> a dog (woke me up).; (John told me) <to> wake him up at 6 a.m.; I want <to> do something.; He started do<ing> something.
Use this domain for general words referring to things.
把有关物品的普通词放在这个词群里。

通常提到物品，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: thing, something, article, artifact, entity, item, object, wares,
物、体、物体、物品、事物、实物、东西

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a group of things of different types?

ExampleWords.AUni: things, oddments, paraphernalia, stuff, odds and ends, bits and pieces, knick-knacks,

ExampleWords.AUni: what's its name, thingy, thingamajig, whatchamacallit, whatsit, such and such
就那个、就那什么

Question.AUni: (4) What words are used to end a list of things to indicate that there are more things in the list?
列举一类东西的时候，没有说完但要表示后面还有很多，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: et cetera, etc., and what not, and so forth, and the like, and on and on, ... [ellipsis]

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words describing something that is physical--that you can touch and see, and for words describing something that is non-physical--that you cannot touch or see.
把描述物质（看得见摸得着）和非物质（看不见摸不着）的东西的词放在这个词群里。

ExampleWords.AUni: substance, stuff, matter, material

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that is non-physical?

ExampleWords.AUni: disembodied, extramundane, extrasensory, immaterial, impalpable, incorporeal, instinctive, intangible, intellectual, libidinal, life, mental, metaphysical, nonphysical, nonmaterial, numinous, otherworldly, preternatural, psychic, psychological, rational, reasoning, spiritual, spiritualist, subjective, supernatural, transcendent, transcendental, unbodied, unearthly, unseen, unworldly,

ExampleWords.AUni: spirit

通常提到在一个地方存在的情况，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: situation, things, conditions, state of affairs, set-up, context,
形势、局势、势头、情势、事态、态势、风云、气候、现势、时事、时务、时局、世局、局面、全局、大局

ExampleWords.AUni: under the circumstances, in the circumstances, given the circumstances, given the situation, as it is, as things stand, force of circumstances, the way things are,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for general adjectives that can replace or stand for a specific adjective.

哪些普通词可以替代一个形容词？

ExampleWords.AUni: such, that kind of, that sort of,

AStr.Run: We all admire <such> a man. (a generous man); We all admire <that kind of> a man.; We all admire <that sort of> a man.

Question.AUni: (2) What question words ask for an adjective in the answer?

Use this domain for general adverbs that can replace or stand for other adverbs.

Question.AUni: (1) What general words can replace an adverb?
哪些普通词可以替代一个副词？

ExampleWords.AUni: thus, thusly, so, how, like this, this way, in that way, in this manner
如此、这样、如此一来、这样的话、那样的话、这样说来、像这样、多、多么

AStr.Run: We would like you to do it <thus>.; I'll show you <how> I want it.

This domain is for organization purposes and should not be used for any words. Use the domains in this section for words that belong to a particular part of speech. It is best not to use these domains, since they are based on grammar and not meaning. But if you have a small group of words that belong to a part of speech and you want to list them all, you can use these domains. You can also classify words in this section if you don't know what they mean yet.
这个词群只是用于组织，所以不要把任何的单词放在这里。把属于某种词性的词放在这个部分的词群里。由于这些词群名基于的是语法而不是意思，所以最好不要使用它们。但是如果你有一些词属于某种词性并想把它们都列出来，那么你可以使用这些词群名。如果你还不知道这个部分里词的意思，你也可以为它们分类。

Use this domain to list all adjectives. If there are many adjectives in your language, you should not try to list them all here. If you want to find all the adjectives, most dictionary programs can sort your dictionary by part of speech. However if your language only has a few adjectives, you can list them all in this domain. In the book, "Where Have All the Adjectives Gone?" R. M. W. Dixon [Dixon, R. M. W. 1982. Where have all the adjectives gone? Berlin: Mouton.] identifies seven universal semantic types that are often expressed by adjectives. They are: Age (new, young, old), Dimension (big, little, long, short, wide, narrow, thick, fat, thin), Value (good, bad, proper, perfect, excellent, fine, delicious, atrocious, poor), Color (black, white, red), Human propensity (jealous, happy, kind, clever, generous, cruel, rude, proud, wicked), Physical property (hard, soft, heavy, light, rough, smooth, hot, cold, sweet, sour), Speed (fast, slow). Words in the Human propensity class may be nouns. Words in the Physical property and Speed classes may be verbs.
把所有的形容词放在这个词群里。如果在你使用的语言当中形容词很多，可以不必在这里把它们列出来。使用Shoebox这个程序（以及其它的字典程序）可以按照词性来对你们的词典进行分类。

Question.AUni: (1) What are the adjectives in your language?

ExampleWords.AUni: young, big, good, black, kind, hot, fast,

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all adverbs. If there are many adverbs in your language, it is probably not worth the trouble to list them here. The Shoebox program (and other dictionary programs) can sort your dictionary by part of speech.
把所有的副词都放在这个词群里。如果在你使用的语言当中副词很多，可以不必在这里把它们列出来。使用Shoebox这个程序（以及其它的字典程序）可以按照词性来对你们的词典进行分类。

Question.AUni: (1) What adverbs are in your language?

ExampleWords.AUni: quickly

AStr.Run: Use this domain for the personal pronouns, including independent, subject, object, and possessive pronouns. It is best to collect all the pronouns in a chart. This way you are more certain of collecting them all and seeing how they are related to each other. A language may have more sets and more distinctions than English does, or it may have less. For instance some languages have a pronoun 'we' which includes the hearer, and another pronoun 'we' which excludes the hearer. Other languages have an indefinite pronoun that means something like the English word 'someone'. Many languages do not have the masculine (he), feminine (she), and neuter (it) distinctions that English has. It is necessary to determine the sets and functions of the pronouns for each language.

把人称代词（包括主格、宾格、所有格）放在这个词群里。最好使用画表格的方式来收集这些词，这样可以确保收齐所有的词并了解它们之间的相互关系。和英语相比有些语言可能会有更多组这样的词，区别也可能会更大，但也可能正好相反。比如，在有些语言中有个“我们”会包括听者在内，而另一个“我们”就不包括听者。另外一些语言当中会有不定代词，意思相当于英语当中的“某人”。很多语言里没有象英语当中的男性（他）、女性（她）和中性（它）之分。对于每一种语言都有必要确定代词的分组和功能。

Question.AUni: (1) What general words refer to the class of pronouns?
通常提到代词的种类，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: pronoun
代词、代名词、人称代词、物主代词、不定代词

Question.AUni: (2) What pronouns refer to the speaker?
提到和我有关的代词，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: I, me, my, mine
我、咱、俺、人家、本人、个人、在下、我的

Question.AUni: (3) What pronouns refer to the speaker and those associated with the speaker?
提到和我们有关的代词，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: we, us, our, ours
我们、咱们、吾辈、我们的

Question.AUni: (4) What pronouns refer to the audience?
提到和你以及你们有关的代词，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: you, your, yours
你、您、你的、您的、你们、你们的、尔、汝

Question.AUni: (5) What pronouns refer to the people or things being spoken about?
提到和他（们）、她（们）、它（们）有关的代词，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: he, him, his, she, her, hers, it, its, they, them, their, theirs
他、她、它、他们、她们、它们、他们的、她们的、它们的

Question.AUni: (6) What pronouns are used for the subject of a sentence?
哪些代词在句子里作主语？

ExampleWords.AUni: I, you, he, she, it, we, you, they
我、你、他、她、它、彼、我们、你们、他们、她们、它们、别人、人家、他人、旁人、大家、大伙儿、诸位、各位、列位

AStr.Run: <I> went to town.

Question.AUni: (7) What pronouns are used for the object of a sentence?
哪些代词在句子里作宾语？

ExampleWords.AUni: me, you, him, her, it, us, you, them
我、你、他、她、它、彼、我们、你们、他们、她们、它们、别人、人家、他人、旁人、大家、大伙儿、诸位、各位、列位

AStr.Run: John hit <me>.

Question.AUni: (8) What pronouns are used in a possessive phrase?
哪些代词用在所有格短语里？

ExampleWords.AUni: my, your, his, her, its, our, your, their
我的、你的、他的、她的、它的、我们的、你们的、他们的、她们的、它们的

AStr.Run: This is <my> house.

Question.AUni: (9) What pronouns are used in a possessive clause?
哪些代词用在所有格从句里？

ExampleWords.AUni: mine, yours, his, hers, its, ours, yours, theirs
我的、你的、他的、她的、它的、我们的、你们的、他们的、她们的、它们的

AStr.Run: That house is <mine>.

Question.AUni: (10) What pronouns are used to emphasize the people or things being spoken about, especially when you are emphasizing that one person does something and not someone else?
哪些代词是用来强调正在被谈论的人或事？尤其是当你强调是某个人而不是其他的人做某一件事情的时候。

ExampleWords.AUni: as for me (I), as for you (you), as for him (he), as for us (we), as for them (they)
至于我/你/他/她/它、至于我们/你们/他们/她们/它们

AStr.Run: He <himself> admits he is guilty.; I did it <myself> without any help.; You can do what you want. <As for me>, I'm not going.
Use this domain for pronouns that refer back to the subject of the sentence. These pronouns should be added to the chart of personal pronouns.
把重新指向句子主语的代词放在这个词群里。应该把这些代词加到人称代词的表格里。

Question.AUni: (1) What pronouns express reflexive reference?
哪些代词表达的是一种反身的涵义？

ExampleWords.AUni: self, myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, yourselves, themselves, oneself
自、己、自己、自个儿、自身、自我、各自、本身、身、我/你/他/她/它自己、我们/你们/他们/她们/它们自己

AStr.Run: I cut <myself>.

Question.AUni: (2) What pronouns express reciprocal reference?
哪些代词表达的是一种相互的涵义？

ExampleWords.AUni: each other, one another
双方、彼此

AStr.Run: They hit <each other>.; We should help <one another>.

Use this domain for pronouns that do not refer to a definite person or thing, but can refer to anyone or anything. Some languages will not have all the sets of pronouns described below. Add each set you find in your language to the pronoun chart.
把不定代词（可以代表任何的人或事但没有代表一个确定的人或事）放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What pronouns express indefinite reference of a person?
哪些代词代表不确定的人？

ExampleWords.AUni: person, who, someone, anyone, everyone, no one, each one, whoever
有人、某人、某某、某某人、任何人、每（一）个人、人人、没有人、没有谁、无论谁、谁、随便哪个人、何人、什么人

Question.AUni: (2) What pronouns express indefinite reference of a thing?
哪些代词代表不确定的东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: thing, what, something, anything, everything, nothing, each thing, whatever, whichever
这、这个、此、那、那个、彼、之、其、该、某、某某、别、别样、另外、另、旁、异、他、某事、某物、任何事、每件事、无论何事、任何一个、哪、哪个、啥、啥子、何事、何物、什么、什么事、什么东西、吗、甚

Question.AUni: (3) What pronouns express indefinite reference of a time?
哪些代词代表不确定的时间？

ExampleWords.AUni: time, period, when, sometime, anytime, every time, never, at no time, each time, whenever, sometimes
某时、某刻、有时、有/某些时候、每次、每一次、随时、无论何时、何时、什么时候

Question.AUni: (4) What pronouns express indefinite reference of a place?
哪些代词代表不确定的地点？

ExampleWords.AUni: place, where, somewhere, anywhere, everywhere, nowhere, each place, wherever, which way
某地、某处、某个地方、无论何地/处、到处、各处、每一处、每个地方、所到之地/处、何地、何处、何方、什么地方

Question.AUni: (5) What pronouns express indefinite reference of a reason?
哪些代词代表不确定的原因？

ExampleWords.AUni: reason, why, for what reason, for some reason, for any reason, for each and every reason, for no reason, why ever
为什么、干什么、干吗、无缘无故、毫无缘由、不管为什么、出于某种原因、为何、何故、何以、咋、焉、什么原因

Question.AUni: (6) What pronouns express indefinite reference of a manner?
哪些代词代表不确定的方式？

ExampleWords.AUni: manner, means, how, somehow, anyhow, every way, no way, each way, however
如何、怎么样、不管怎么样、无论如何、像这样、这样、这么、这么着、如此、如斯、如许、然、那样、那么、那么着、怎样、怎么、怎的、怎生、怎么着、怎、哪样、何如、何等、若何、

Question.AUni: (7) What pronouns express indefinite reference of an amount?
哪些代词代表不确定的数量？

ExampleWords.AUni: amount, how much, however many, however much, plenty
多少、几、几许、几何、几多、若干

AStr.Run: Use this domain for pronouns used in relative clauses.
把用在关系从句里的代词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What pronouns are used in relative clauses?
哪些代词是用在关系从句里的？

ExampleWords.AUni: who, whom, that, which, why
中文没有关系代词这个概念。

AStr.Run: I'm looking for the man <who> killed John.; I found the coin <that> I lost.; That is the reason <why> I did it.
Use this domain for pronouns used in questions.
把用在疑问句中的代词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What pronouns are used in questions?
哪些代词是用在疑问句里的？

ExampleWords.AUni: who, what, when, where, how, why
谁、哪个人、什么、什么东西、何时、什么时候、哪里、哪儿、什么地方、如何、怎么样、为什么、为何、多、多少、多长时间、多久

AStr.Run: <Who> is that?; <Where> did you go?; <How many> did you get?; <How often> will you go?; <Why> did you do that?
Use this domain for demonstrative pronouns.
把指示代词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What pronouns are used to indicate a particular referent?
哪些代词用来指特定的人或东西？

ExampleWords.AUni: a, an, the, this, these, that, those, specific,
一个、这、这个、那、那个、这些、那些

AStr.Run: <the> leader; <a> really old man; <this> new shirt; <these> tomatoes; <that> book; <those> flowers; I want <this>.; <That> is what I want.
Use this domain for words that indicate that someone does something himself, rather than through someone else.
把有关亲自做什么事情（自己一个人而不通过其他人）的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate that you do something yourself, rather than through someone else?
提到亲自做什么事情，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: personally, in person, direct
亲自、亲身、亲、亲手、亲口、亲眼、本人、直接

AStr.Run: You don't need to do anything. I will take care of it <personally>.; Instead of sending a representative, he is coming <in person>.; You can talk to him <direct>.

Question.AUni: (2) What words are used to indicate that you make something yourself rather than using a machine?
提到你用手而不是通过机器来制作什么东西，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: by hand
亲手、用手工的方式

AStr.Run: We made this book entirely <by hand>, using locally available materials.
Use this domain to list all prepositions and postpositions.
把所有的前置词和后置词都放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What prepositions are in your language?
你的语言当中有哪些前置词？

ExampleWords.AUni: in, on, at, from, to, away, toward, about,
在、于、当、临、赶、趁、乘、从、自从、自、由、打、顺、沿、向、朝、往、望、为、给、替、同、跟、对于、对、把、拿、将、管、连、关于、除了、除、除开、除去、至于、就、和、以、由于、因为、用、归、依照、依、按照、按、照、根据、据、凭、论、鉴于、随着、随、本着、通过、与、比、被、让、叫

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all conjunctions.
把所有的连词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What conjunctions are in your language?

ExampleWords.AUni: and, or, but,

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all phrase level conjunctions--conjunctions that join two words within a phrase.
把所有的短语连词（把两个词连接起来组成短语的词）放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What conjunctions join two words within a phrase?
哪些连词可以把两个词连成一个短语？

ExampleWords.AUni: and, both...and, or, either...or, neither...nor, but,

AStr.Run: coming <and> going; me <and> you; men <and> women; <both> this <and> that; <either> good <or> bad; <neither> good <nor> bad; quickly <but> not carelessly
Use this domain to list all clause level conjunctions--conjunctions that join two clauses.
把所有的从句一级的连词（可以把两个从句连接起来的词）放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What conjunctions join two clauses?
哪些连词可以连接两个从句？

ExampleWords.AUni: and, or, while, then, if, because,

AStr.Run: You come here <and> I'll go there.; You come here <or> I'll go there.; You come here <while> I go there.; You come here <then> I'll go there.; <If> you come here, I'll go there.
Use this domain to list all sentence level conjunctions--conjunctions that join two sentences.
把所有的句子一级的连词（可以把两个句子连接起来的词）放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What conjunctions join two sentences?
哪些连词可以连接两个句子？（中文里的连词都是连接分句的）

ExampleWords.AUni: then, so,

AStr.Run: I want you to come here. <Then> I'll go there.; You wanted to come here. <So> I decided to let you.
Use this domain to list all particles.
把所有的小品词放在这个词群里。（助词）

Question.AUni: (1) What particles are in your language?

ExampleWords.AUni: He lives <just> across the street.

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all classifiers.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate the class of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: (Japanese) -hon (long objects), -mai (flat objects), -ban (order in a series), -nin (people), -fun (minutes), -dai (large vehicles)

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all interjections.
把所有的感叹词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What interjections are in your language?

ExampleWords.AUni: Wow! Hold on! Good grief!

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all idiophones. If there are many idiophones in your language, it is probably not worth the trouble to list them here. The Shoebox program (and other dictionary programs) can sort your dictionary by part of speech.
把所有的象声词放在这个词群里。如果在你使用的语言当中象声词很多，可以不必在这里把它们列出来。使用Shoebox这个程序（以及其它的字典程序）可以按照词性来对你们的词典进行分类。

Question.AUni: (1) What idiophones are in your language?

ExampleWords.AUni: knick-knack, flimflam

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all affixes that do not fit in any of the subdomains under it. This section should be filled out by a linguist.
把所有的词缀都放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What affixes are in your language?

ExampleWords.AUni: -s, -ed, -ing

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all verb affixes.
把所有的动词词缀都放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What affixes can be joined to verbs?

ExampleWords.AUni: -ing, -ed, -s

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all noun affixes.
把所有的名词词缀都放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What affixes can be joined to nouns?

ExampleWords.AUni: -s, -en

AStr.Run: Use this domain to list all derivational affixes. A derivational affix is joined to a root and changes it into a different word. Derivational affixes often change the root into a different part of speech. Adding a derivational affix usually changes the meaning of the root in a significant way.
把所有的派生词缀都放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What derivational affixes are there?

ExampleWords.AUni: un-, a-, self-, super-, -ment, -hood, -ous, -ly, -fy

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that intensify an attribute.
把强化特征的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words intensify an attribute?
要对特征起进行强化，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: very, really, highly, deeply, real, so, mighty, one, quite, ever so, bloody, decidedly, too, proper, true, extremely, such
非常、特别、特、格外、分外、十分、相当、比较、较、很、挺、蛮、多、多么、何等、何其、颇、老、死、要命、要死、过分、过度、过头、过火、过、过于、真的、的确、确实

AStr.Run: <very> green; <too> dark; <really> fast; <real> good; <pretty> heavy

Question.AUni: (2) What words intensify an attribute to an extreme degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: extremely, terribly, dreadfully, incredibly, unbelievably, ridiculously, absurdly, remarkably, exceptionally, extraordinarily, terrifically, enormously, hugely, exceedingly,

Question.AUni: (3) What words indicate that an attribute is not intense?
要表示特征不是很明显，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: not very, hardly, barely, a little, fairly
稍微、稍、稍稍、稍许、略微、略、略略、微微、有点、有些、多少

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that indicate a degree on a scale.
把表明测量结果的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words refer to the degree of something?

ExampleWords.AUni: degree, extent, level, thus

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate a degree on a scale?
提到等级，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: high, low, greater, lesser, first, primary, secondary,

AStr.Run: Ambassador Stevenson is a very <high> level official.; <Low> priority tasks should be placed later in the list.; The musician gave a <first> rate performance.; Finding a suitable place to live was of <primary> importance.

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to a marked extent?
提到一个显著的程度，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: up to, as much as, to the degree that
达到、相当于、等于、等同于

Question.AUni: (4) What words refer to a change in degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: fluctuate, fluctuation, move, vary,

Question.AUni: (5) What words express a comparative degree?
提到比较级，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: more, -er
更、较

AStr.Run: fast<er>

Question.AUni: (6) What words express a superlative degree?
提到最高级，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: most, -est
最

AStr.Run: fast<est>
Use this domain for words referring to a large degree.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate a large degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: large, great, major, considerable, large scale, huge, enormous, immense, tremendous, high, advanced, rich,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to a large degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: size, magnitude,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a small degree.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate a small degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: deficient, inappreciably, inconsequentially, insignificantly, lacking, lightly, limited, little, low, merely, moderately, negligibly, piddling, possible, puny, reasonably, relatively, slightly, somewhat, sparingly, temperately, trivial, trivially,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a larger degree.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is becoming larger in degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: advance, double, explode, gain, grow, increase, jump, rise, rocket, soar, triple,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the amount by which something became larger?

ExampleWords.AUni: growth, explosion, hike, increase, rise,

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to causing something to become larger in degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: increase, raise, swell

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something is larger than another thing in degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: more than,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a smaller degree.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is becoming smaller in degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: decline, decrease, diminish, drop, dwindle, fall, plummet, slide, tumble,

Question.AUni: (2) What words refer to the amount by which something became smaller?

ExampleWords.AUni: decline (n), decrease, fall, reduction, tumble

Question.AUni: (3) What words refer to causing something to become smaller in degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: decrease, lower, reduce,

Question.AUni: (4) What words indicate that something is smaller than another thing in degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: less than, lower,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a complete degree--when something is done, happens, is thought, is felt, etc completely and in every way.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is done to a complete degree?

ExampleWords.AUni: completely, fully, totally, entirely, wholly, absolutely, utterly, positively, in every way, in every respect, in every sense, through and through, whole-heartedly, altogether, out-and-out, outright, perfect, perfectly, roundly, solid, solidly, thoroughly, unmitigated, unqualified, utter,

Question.AUni: (2) What general words refer to all of something's attributes or manners?
通常提到什么东西所有的品质特征，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: completely, in every way,
在各个方面、无论哪个方面

Question.AUni: (3) What words describe something that is done completely?

ExampleWords.AUni: complete, thorough, full, comprehensive, exhaustive, entire,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words referring to a complete degree--when something is done, happens, is thought, is felt, etc completely and in every way.

Question.AUni: (1) What words indicate that something is done partly?

ExampleWords.AUni: partly, partially, to some extent, to a certain extent, to a degree, to some degree, up to a point, in part, sort of,

Question.AUni: (2) What words indicate that something is done one part at a time?

ExampleWords.AUni: gradually, in stages, step by step, one step at a time, in increments, incrementally, piecemeal, by degrees, little by little,

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words indicating intensity of an action.

Question.AUni: (1) What words are used to indicate that something is being done intensely?
提到什么事情正在被加紧完成，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: intense, intensely, extensively
加紧、抓紧

AStr.Run: Use this domain for words that modify an attribute.
把修饰特征的词放在这个词群里。

Question.AUni: (1) What words modify an attribute?
哪些词可以修饰特征？

ExampleWords.AUni: fairly, sort of, quite,

AStr.Run: <light> blue, <dark> red, <dull> gray, <faded> colors

Name.AUni: 和动词相关的语义成分

AStr.Run: Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that modify verbs.
把修饰动词的助词、词缀、副词、小品词放在这个词群里。
Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate tense and aspect.
把表明时态和体的助词、词缀、副词和小品词放在这个词群里。

Use this domain for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate tense (also known as temporal deixis)--the time of a situation (event, activity, or state) in relation to a reference point, which is usually the time of utterance. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.
把表明时态的助词、词缀、副词和小品词放在这个词群里。时态具有指示时间的功能，是一个情况、事件、活动或状态发生或存在的时间和参照点之间的关系，通常就是说话的时间。以下的定义取自Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca所著1994年芝加哥大学出版社出版的《语法的发展-芝加哥与伦敦》。

Question.AUni: (1) present: the situation occurs simultaneously with the moment of speech.
现在：在说话那一刻同时发生的情况
(2) past: the situation occurred before the moment of speech.
过去：在说话之前发生的情况
(3) future: the situation takes place after the moment of speech; the speaker predicts that the situation in the proposition will hold.
将来：在说话之后发生的状况，说话的人预测那种情况将会存在
(4) crastinal: tomorrow.
将来：明天
(5) hesternal: yesterday.
以前：昨天
(6) hodiernal: today, normally with past.
现在：今天、通常和过去有关
(7) pre-hodiernal: before today.
现在之前：今天之前
(8) post-crastinal: after tomorrow.
将来之后：明天之后
(9) ancient past: used for narrating events in ancient or mythical time.
远古的过去：用来叙述古时候或传说中的事件
(10) remote: combines with other tense labels to indicate a situation occurring temporally distant from the moment of speech.
遥远：一个标志，和其它时态相结合表明一种发生在离说话的时刻暂时比较远的情况
(11) immediate: a meaning label that may be combined with other tense labels to indicate a situation not simultaneous with the moment of speech, but very close to it.
立即：一个定义标签，可以和其它时态标签相结合表明一种和说话的时刻不同步但非常接近的情况。
(12) immediate future: what is about to occur.
立即的将来：快要发生的事
(13) immediate past: occurring immediately before the moment of speech. Also called the Recent Past. Do not use this label if there is any sense of current relevance--use anterior for that.
刚刚的过去：就发生在说话的那一刻之前。也叫做最近的过去。如果有和现在相关的时态，可以使用前面的标志，而不要使用这个标志。
(14) Immediate may also be combined with anterior or imperative.
立即也可以和前面的标志或祈使句共用。
(15) expected future: the situation is to occur in the near future; what is scheduled to happen.
期待将来：这种情况很快就会发生；计划好要发生的事情
(16) narrative time: the use of a form with no other past uses for reporting a past narrative.
叙述的时间：一种不使用其它过去用法来叙述过去事件的方法

(17) gnomic present: the situation described in the proposition is generic; the predicate has held, holds, and will hold for the class of entities named by the subject, such as 'Elephants have trunks'.
格言式现在：在这种命题中所描述的情况是通常性的；谓语已经控制、一直控制并将要控制宾语所标明的实体分类。比如，“大象有长鼻子”。
(18) What general words refer to the tense of an event?
通常提到一个事件的时态，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: tense, time
时态、时间、时候

Question.AUni: (19) What words are used to indicate the present tense?
哪些词用来表示现在时态？

ExampleWords.AUni: (no words or affixes in English)
正在、在

Question.AUni: (20) What words are used to indicate the past tense?
哪些词用来表示过去时态？

ExampleWords.AUni: -ed, (in English vowel replacement is also used to indicate past tense, e.g. run, ran)
已经、早已、早就、过

Question.AUni: (21) What words are used to indicate the future tense?
哪些词用来表示将来时态？

ExampleWords.AUni: will, going to
将、将要、将会、会

AStr.Run: Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate aspects of dynamic verbs. Aspects describe the temporal contours of a situation. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.
把表明动态动词体的助词、词缀、副词和小品词放在这个词群里。各种体描述了某种情况暂时的轮廓。它们可以和任何的时态相结合，既可以在相同的语素中，也可以在各种语素的组合中。以下的定义取自Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca所著1994年芝加哥大学出版社出版的《语法的发展-芝加哥与伦敦》。

Question.AUni: (1) habitual: the situation is customary or usual, repeated on different occasion over a period of time. English 'used to' is past habitual; English 'Nancy sings' is present habitual.
习惯：通常或惯例性的会在某一段时间不同的场合重复的一种情况。汉语里“过去经常”表示一种过去的习惯；“小张唱歌”表示一种现在的习惯。

(2) continuous: a single situation is viewed as in progress, as maintained over a period of time; also called "durative." The English "Progressive" is a continuous restricted to dynamic words. English 'I am reading; *I am knowing the number'.
持续：被看作在进行中的一种单一的情况，会在一段时间里被维持。也可以称作为“延续”。在汉语里受“正在”约束的持续性行为。“我正在看书。”
(3) continuative: keep on doing what is being done. Restricted to dynamic words.
断续：继续做需要完成的事。受动态词的约束。

(4) progressive: the action takes place simultaneously with the moment of reference, 'to be in the process of...'. This is more restricted than the English Progressive, which may be used for events that are not actually in progress at reference time: 'I am writing a book' may be used even if the speaker is not at that moment writing.
进行：和参照时间同时发生的行为。“正在…的当中”，可以用来表示并非确实在参照时间进行的事情。比如，“我正在写一本书。”不一定表示说话的人当时正在写。
(5) excessive duration: action is extended over a long period of time, longer than normal for that action.
过度地持续：行为延长到一个很长的时间段，比正常所需的时间长。
(6) limited duration: action performed for a relatively short or bounded period of time.
有限的持续：行为持续相对较短或有限的一段时间
(7) iterative: the action is repeated on one occasion; usually restricted to dynamic words, often further restricted to semelfactive words.
重复：行为在某种场合下反复重复；通常受动态词的限制，而且会进一步受semelfactive词的限制。
(8) frequentative: action occurs frequently, not necessarily habitually, nor necessarily on one occasion, as is the iterative.
反复：行为频繁发生，不一定是习惯性的，也不一定在某种场合下，本身就具有重复性。
(9) imperfective: the situation is viewed as unbounded in the sense that it is habitual, continuous, progressive, or iterative.
未完成：这种情况在习惯、持续、进行或重复体中不受限制
(10) perfective: the situation is viewed as bounded temporally. It cannot be simultaneous with the moment of speech; in the non-past it is sometimes interpreted as future.
完成：这是一种被认为暂时性受限的情况。它不可能在说话的时候就发生。在非过去的情况下有时会被认为有将来的意思。
(11) completive: to do something thoroughly and to completion, e.g. 'to shoot someone dead, to eat up'.
完全：彻底完全地做完某事。比如“打死某人；吃完”
(12) inceptive: the action or event begins. We are distinguishing this from the beginning of a state.
起初：行为或事件的开始。我们正在将这种情况同一种状态的开始区分开来。
(13) delimited: action is performed only a little.
限定：行为只进行了一小点
(14) The preceding terms or "Aspects" are not usually relevant to stative words.
上述的术语或“体”并不总是和陈述性的词对应的。
(15) What general words refer to an aspect of an event?
通常提到一个事件的体，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: aspect
体

Question.AUni: (16) What words are used to indicate that something has begun?
哪些词表示事情已经开始了？

ExampleWords.AUni: begin, start, commence, beginning, the start, commencement, initiate, to institute, inception
开、始、开始、开头、开端、发端、起、上马、萌芽、破天荒、启动、起头

Question.AUni: (17) What do people say when they want someone else to start?
如果想要别人开始做什么事情，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: go, dig in, have at it, let's go, let's do it, move it, let's get going, "on your marks, get set, go", "ready, set, go"
去、赶快、开始吧、预备，开始、动手啊、还等什么、别犹豫了、来啊、走吧

Question.AUni: (18) What is a person called who starts something?
提到开始做什么事情的人，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: initiator, founder, originator, starter
创始人、奠基人、发起人、组织者、发明家

Question.AUni: (19) What words are used to indicate that someone is attempting to do something?
提到某人试图做什么事情，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: try, attempt
努力、尽力、试图、试、尝试、试验、企图、探索、试探

Question.AUni: (20) What words are used to indicate that something is being done quickly?
提到什么事情正在被快速地完成，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: quick, quickly, rapidly
快、快速、迅速、飞速、赶

Question.AUni: (21) What words are used to indicate that something happened suddenly?
提到什么事情突然发生，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: sudden, suddenly, suddenness, immediate
突、突然、忽然、猛然、冷不防、冷不丁、陡然、陡、骤然、骤

Question.AUni: (22) What words are used to indicate something is continuing?
提到什么事情在继续，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: continue, continuous, keep on
继续、持续、延续、接续、接连、连连、不断、不迭

Question.AUni: (23) What words are used to indicate that something has been completed?
提到什么事情已经完成了，你会怎么说？

ExampleWords.AUni: complete, finish, succeed
完成、结束、完事、完工、实现、成就、落实、达成、达到、成功、成事、告成、大功告成

AStr.Run: Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate aspects of stative verbs. Aspects describe the temporal contours of a situation. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.
把表明陈述性动词体的助词、词缀、副词和小品词放在这个词群里。各种体描述了某种情况暂时的轮廓。它们可以和任何的时态相结合，既可以在相同的语素中，也可以在各种语素的组合中。以下的定义取自Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca所著1994年芝加哥大学出版社出版的《语法的发展-芝加哥与伦敦》。

Question.AUni: (1) state exists: the state is begun before reference time and continues after reference time.
状态存在：状态开始于参照时间之前并在参照时间之后继续存在。

ExampleWords.AUni: is,

Question.AUni: (2) state commences: beginning of a state of "becoming." Often called Inceptive or Inchoative. If there is a morpheme specifically for this meaning, it is usually derivational and restricted to stative words. However, it is also possible for "Perfects" or "Perfectives" to have this as their use with stative words.
状态开始：一种“变成…”的状态的开始。经常被称作开始或起始。如果有特别针对这个意思的语素，它往往是源于并受限于陈述性动词。然而，“完成”或“完全”式在和陈述性动词连用时也有可能这种体。

ExampleWords.AUni: becoming,

Question.AUni: (3) state ends: state existed in the past, but no longer exists. Also a possible meaning of "Perfects" or "Perfectives" in combination with stative words.
状态结束：状态在过去存在，但现在不再存在。“完成”或“完全”式在和陈述性的词连用时也可能有这个意思。

ExampleWords.AUni: no longer,

Question.AUni: (4) state continues: state is continuing a reference time.
状态持续：状态持续参照的时间那么长的一段时间。

ExampleWords.AUni: still,

Question.AUni: (5) state changes: (self-explanatory).
状态改变：（不需要说明）

ExampleWords.AUni: turn,

AStr.Run: Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate relational tenses. Relational tenses describe situations where the reference time is not the same as the moment of speech. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes. The following definitions are taken from Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca. 1994. The evolution of grammar. Chicago and London: University of Chicago Press.
把表明相关时态的助词、词缀、副词和小品词放在这个词群里。相关时态描述了一种参照时间与说话时间不同步的情况。它们可以和任何的时态相结合，既可以在相同的语素中，也可以在各种语素的组合中。以下的定义取自Bybee, Joan, Revere Perkins, and William Pagliuca所著1994年芝加哥大学出版社出版的《语法的发展-芝加哥与伦敦》。

Question.AUni: (1) resulting state (resultative): action in the past produces a state that persists into the present.
结果状态：过去的行为所造成的延续到如今的状态

ExampleWords.AUni: be... -en,

Question.AUni: (2) anterior continuing: past action continues into the present: 'I have waited over an hour' ( = and I'm still waiting).
先前的持续：过去的行为持续到如今。“我已经等了一个小时了。”（=我现在仍然在等。）

ExampleWords.AUni: have been... -ing,

Question.AUni: (3) anterior: the situation occurs prior to reference time, and is relevant to the situation at reference time. This is different from a simple past or perfective, where the situation is reported for its own sake and independent of its relevance to any other situation.
先前：情况发生在参照时间之前，和在参照时间所发生的事相关联。这和普通的过去式或完成式不同，因为它们中间的情况都只和自己的原因有关，与任何其它的情况没有关系。

ExampleWords.AUni: have... -en,

Question.AUni: (4) A form that signals a situation that is prior to and relevant to a past reference time will be coded with two meaning labels, past and anterior.
用来表示先于某个过去的参照时间并和这个时间有关的情况的一种形式将用过去和先前两种定义标签来进行编码。

ExampleWords.AUni: had... -en,

AStr.Run: Use this section for verbal auxiliaries, affixes, adverbs, and particles that indicate agent-oriented modalities. Agent-oriented modalities describe internal or external conditions on a willful agent with respect to the completion of the predicate situation. They may be combined with any of the tenses, either in the same morpheme or in combinations of morphemes.
